Review: I’ve been in need of a new chair for a while, and I always tended to buy the cheap “gaming” chairs that look cool but are super low-quality and break down within a year. I decided to finally invest more money, and this chair greatly exceeds my expectations. The material used is a mesh that is incredibly strong and surprisingly comfortable. The adjustable headrest and dynamic lumbar support are standout features, providing excellent support for my back and neck. The lumbar support adjusts with your body, making it feel like the chair was custom-made for you.Additionally, the chair includes a footrest that you can easily push back and hide under the chair, which is nice when you feel like relaxing. The overall build quality is impressive, and it’s clear that no corners were cut in its construction. This chair was well worth the extra money, and I am greatly impressed with its quality and features. If you’re looking for a durable and comfortable office/gaming chair, I highly recommend this one. It has made a noticeable difference in my daily comfort and productivity.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024

Review: This chair is amazing! This is very comfortable and provides great support for long work hours. It has adjustable height, tilt, and armrests, making it easy to customize. The breathable mesh back keeps you cool, and the lumbar support helps reduce back pain. Assembly is quick and simple, and the overall quality is excellent.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2024

Review: This chair has to be the most comfortable chair I have sat on. You can really feel the lumbar support for your back unlike most chairs that claim to have a great lumbar support. I have been using it for a few days now and I no longer feel any pain from by back because of horrible posture. This chair really helps you sit upright without hindering the comfort. The best part is that this chair was really simple and easy to build. The instructions were literally only TWO PAGES. I even timed myself to see how long it would take to build and it took me no less than 40 minutes of jamming and building. The reward was the extremely luxurious feeling of the chair. I highly recommend anyone to buy this chair if you’re looking for something with good comfort and durability. The chair is stable at all times with no feeling of discomfort. I sit in awkward positions all the time and even sitting cross legged on this chair doesn’t feel bad at all. I use this chair for 7-10 hours a day and it really can’t get any better than this, the seat height is adjustable and fits in my tight corner space. As evident by the pictures, not only does it feel good but it also looks good. The chair is also really quiet and doesn’t make any squeaking noises.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2024

Review: Overall I am happy with this chair. I am not sure I can give 5 stars, but definitely more than 4.The first chair I ordered on Black Friday had an issue with the hydraulic system about 4 months in, but PatioMage was very quick to help me resolve. They offered me a brand new chair and is working great as of the time this review is written.Pros: (1) Directions are fairly clear for assembly. No additional tools needed outside of what is provided, but I would recommend a large work area to assemble efficiently. (2) Comfortable to sit in, even for long periods of time. (3) Seat and arm rests are easy to adjust and can accommodate many heights. (4) Sturdy - I don't expect the materials to break down anytime soon. Nothing looks "cheap". (5) Lumbar support has been great so far.Cons: This could be me being nit-picky, but I think these are important considerations. (1) No lock on arm rests. They can shift outward if, for example, your chair rotates into your desk. (2) No lock on the foot rest. I would prefer if the foot rest feature would not slide out unnecessarily.All-in-all, if you are looking for a gaming chair that isn't cheap material, but also doesn't break the bank, I think this one does the job.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2024

Review: I've been using the PatioMage Executive Ergonomic Mesh Office Chair for several weeks now, and as someone who works from home for 8-10 hours a day, I feel compelled to share how this chair has been a literal lifesaver for me. As a bigger guy at 6'2" and 300lbs, finding the right office chair that provides both comfort and support for long hours can be a real challenge. But let me tell you, the PatioMage has been a game changer.First off, the ergonomic design of this chair is something to rave about. It's like it was tailor-made for my body, aligning perfectly with the natural curves of my spine. The ability to adjust virtually every aspect of this chair – from the headrest, lumbar support, armrest, to the seat depth and height – has allowed me to find that sweet spot of comfort that I need for my long workdays.The adjustable seat depth, in particular, has been a standout feature. It's incredible how a small adjustment to fit my leg length can make such a significant difference in comfort, especially for someone of my size. The lumbar support deserves a special mention too. It has a lift and rotate feature that has provided my lower back with the kind of support I didn't even realize I was missing. It's been a huge relief for my back, especially on those longer workdays.Now, let's talk about the armrests. The 3D adjustability here is nothing short of impressive. They move up and down, forward and backward, left and right, ensuring my arms are always in the most comfortable position.And the materials! I used to get sweaty from my last office chair, but not with the high-elastic special soft mesh because it is both breathable and durable, making it perfect for sitting for long hours. The chair comes with a footrest, but I don't seem to use it much. They cut no corners with the build quality, from the moment you sit down you will feel nothing but a sturdy throne.I won't say it's been all roses, though. Getting the adjustments right took some time and patience, especially for someone of my size. Assembling this chair is a pain as it uses hex bolts, to which they provide a small tool. It would help to have a second person. This chair is also on the pricier side too, which might not fit everyone's budget, and it's a bit bulky, so make sure you have the space for it. Also, a few more color options would have been nice.But overall, if you're a bigger person looking for a high-quality, ergonomic office chair that can withstand long hours, the PatioMage is a solid choice. It's transformed my work-from-home experience, and I genuinely feel more productive and less fatigued at the end of the day. Just be ready for a bit of a learning curve with the adjustments and assembly!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023

Review: This chair is seriously comfy. The ergonomic design is on point, and the footrest is a game-changer (pun intended). Whether you're gaming or working, you'll appreciate the support it provides.The reclining feature is also a nice touch. Being able to adjust the angle is great for preventing stiffness during long sessions. And the swivel and rocker functions? Super convenient.Now, onto durability. While the chair feels solid overall, there are a few areas that could be improved. Some users have reported issues with the armrests feeling a bit wobbly, and the fabric can be prone to wear and tear over time.And let's talk about that navy blue color. It's stylish, sure, but it might not be to everyone's taste. Personally, I love it, but I can see how some people might prefer something a bit more neutral.Overall, I'd give the GTRACING Footrest, Ergonomic Computer Game Desk, Reclining Gamer Chair a solid 4 out of 5 stars. It's comfy, supportive, and built to last, but it's not without its minor flaws. If you're in the market for a gaming chair, it's definitely worth considering.

Reviewer: Dowinx Gaming Chair - My Honest Review
Review: It was certainly an upgrade from the literal piece of garbage I was using before, so please understand that while skimming this review.This chair was the perfect fit for my frame and weights, it being 6', 225lbs. The firmness is just right, although I don't always like overly cushy things to sit on because I don't like the feeling of sinking while I'm trying to work or play games.Perfect width for me, the pillows are a nice touch, even if the vibrating back pillow is underused by me, it doesn't do much more than tenderize my back, which I guess can be useful. It's nice, but not like a real massage chair.I love the leg rest! It's a good length for my legs, and I love that I can full-on lay down in this chair. Perfect.I think it's really comfy! It fits me very well and it's smooth. Also, it's exceptionally simple to assemble! Not a ton of screws to fiddle with, and everything else just slips right in to place.The smooth fabric is also nice. That's just my preference though, but I do gotta say, the fabric is a good one.I think this is s great chair for it's price!

Review: About as average as it gets, Im a 5’10”, 170lbs male and the chair fits me ok id say, also my much shorter and light wife uses it with about the same its ok feeling. Seems a bit wide in respect to arm rests maybe i should have bought the full rail arm rest one.USES-work from home, gaming, soon to be online college which will be the real test.CONS--When sitting upright as normal The arm rests really aren't located correctly for my elbows/arms. To wide and far forward with no adjustment in that axis.-The chair starts squeaking a month or so after using, kinda annoying but from i hear most do this.-had a faulty wheel that would break apart every few mins of use, but they sent free replacements and its been fine since.-lean or (rocking) feature is stiff to use unless the chair is already leaned back making most of my upper body weight is past the chairs center point. If i was 6’3” and 250lbs maybe it would be easier but even with chair set to least rocking resistance i have to have feet on desk or heavily leaned to get chair to stay rocked back (the spot i prefer to game in). Easy fix would be the ability to lock after leaning back but mine does not do that sadly.-shoulda taken that cheap useless afterthought cell phone level vibration device out of lumbar support and added heating. Or just saved me the difference as its not like it massages, and the cord is short, unusable, and would be in the way even if it did reach anything.PROS--lots, dont let my cons steer you away, i still love this chair.-looks amazing, great material for the chair,-seems like material will last, me and my wife have been using 2 months looks like its brand like its never been sat in, foams not sunken a bit, material has no wear, or stretch. Early yet but we will see.-comfortable, more then i expected for this type of chair, assumed less so then full ergo chair but you dont buy a cheaper sports car and expect it to ride like a Bentley so happy for the price for sure.-honestly for the price and what I've seen other chairs go for and ppl i know bought I'm super happy with this.-foot rest is nice at times, more sturdy then i thought when looking at it.-pillow support nicely positioned-bottom support goodFINAL THOUGHTS--Yes its not perfect, but nothing is, everything is from china or made like made like trash these days so even an 8/10 to me for this price is like finding gold. Im happy with my purchase which is rare these days, quite picky when it comes to spending my money. Id buy again which says it all.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2021

Review: It's pretty easy to put together, has a nice recline function, and is reasonably comfortable to sit in, but it's certainly nothing special. I'm very disappointed by the arm rests. They feel like they're filled with cheap styrofoam and have already squished down and worn out after a month of use, plus one of the arm rests is loose and wiggles when leaning on it. The wheels are pretty mid, so I replaced them with rubber roller caster wheels. There's also a decent number of hard spots when sitting in certain positions, so unless you sit squarely upright at all times, you might get uncomfortable. I'm past my return window, so I guess I'll just stick with it until I'm sick of all the little negatives, which probably won't be long.At a price point around $150, you should keep looking, or at least shell out a bit more for a higher quality chair, you won't regret it.

Presa durante il prima day a 105€, arrivata con una settimana di anticipo.Montaggio semplice (circa 20 minuti), istruzioni chiare ma non in italiano.  Forniscono brugola per avvitare il tutto, ma consiglio l’utilizzo di un avvitatore per fare prima. Le viti sono tutte separate e confezionate.A primo impatto molto comoda, la seduta è ben imbottita ma non si sprofonda, è abbastanza dura.Tessuto sembra buono, vedremo nel tempo.Le ruote scorrono perfettamente su tutte le superficiPiccoli difetti trovati:i ganci del poggia gambe non sembrano solidissimi, vedremo se reggeranno nel tempo.Il cuscino lombare tirandosi su da posizione reclinata, tende a infilarsi tra schienale e seduta. La vibrazione interna nulla di che, ma piacevole (non è una poltrona massaggiante!).Se si è alti sopra il 1.80 meglio incastrare il poggia testa in alto e non come indicato.In definitiva: al prezzo per cui l’ho acquistata ne vale veramente la pena, per 100€ si porta a casa roba improponibile. Credo che fino a 150€ il rapporto qualità prezzo sia perfetto. Sopra forse si può trovare altro ma non ne sarei così sicuro.5 stelle per me ci stanno tutte!!

I bought the grey version as a present for my brothers birthday and really liked the comfort and quality for the price. I noticed the lower back support right away. I was due for a new chair and bought the black version for myself a couple months later. I’m 5’10 and 205 lbs. The cushion is soft and firm. The height is just right with out using the leveler handle to raise it at all. The arm handles  raise up and down which is nice when I’m not using the chair to push it all the way into my desk.I started by mounting the bracket to the bottom of the seat. Then I screwed the arm handles to the back part of the seat first. After that I installed the bottom seat to the handles. Lastly I put the wheels one the base and covers/caps to the arm handles following the cylinder. Don’t forget the cylinder caps before you mount it to the chair. I did the first time around and had to hammer the base out with a towel to avoid damage to uninstall. Easy to assemble & took about 20/30minutes each time. Includes a hex key tool for the screws.Some people mention having a hard time aligning the screws with the holes but I just pressed down firmly when lined up and had no issues for both chairs. Each screw went in all the way to make contact then I tightened all of them when everything was aligned correctly. If you tighten each one right away, it can be uneven or slightly off when assembled.Price at this time is $131.83 and I bought it for $114.69 with a 20% coupon that was offered on the page. Definitely a deal if you can get it under $100

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024

Review: I ordered this as a replacement for my veteran husband's old chair that just wasn't good for his back.So far he loves it and if that changes I will be sure to update with the length of time and the issue.Chair: Husband says it supports his back without being lumpy like some other chairs are. He says the chair is comfortable as far as firmness goes. I saw a lot of reviews saying this chair is as hard as a rock, but my husband has a herniated disk in his back and says it's not that bad. So I guess if you have more sensitivity than that it might be a problem. The color is nice and it is easy to adjust the height.Assembly: It might not be as bad as trying to hang jello to the wall with a nail, but it's not easy like Sunday morning either. Sadder still is that it wasn't too bad until you get to the arms. The holes were slightly misaligned and so it needed a little more effort to get in than expected, but it wasn't a 3-hour project. Mildly irritating.Delivery: Do NOT try ordering this chair next year on cyber Monday and expect it to get to you on time for Christmas or unless there is another option that isn't USPS. I ordered this chair on Nov 30th and it was due to be delivered on the 9th of Dec which is fine. Then it was the 11th, still fine. Then the 13th...wait what? That was a Sunday and the mail doesn't run on Sundays. Then we heard nothing and the very last update I got from USPS was "Traveling in the network." From the 16th until thins morning when it was out for delivery. It's the 27th.The other thing about this is I called USPS not to complain and moan, but just to find out where it was. The USPS lady opened a ticket for my local to call me and my local said it hadn't left Memphis TN yet. On the tracking site, it said it had departed. Irritating, but as long as it wasn't stolen. As I said, if there is another option besides USPS or it is not a holiday season, you should be good.All in all the chair is nice, the assembly was OK and the delivery was naughty af and needs coal next year in its stocking.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2020

Review: I work remotely 100% and needed to find a chair that was great for lower lumbar and overall back support, as I sit most of the day, 8-10 hrs each day! I was able to do most of it by myself, but I definitely needed help with an additional person to install the bottom seat to the back of the seat.  Also, the leather material on the seat, as well as, on the back seat piece was overlapping the holes causing the screws to not go in straight or even all the way, making it difficult to attach the arms.  Having said that, I had to cut the excess leather away from the holes in order to allow the screws to go in straight and in all the way!  That was a bit frustrating to say the least and a bit of a challenge!!  Overall, I absolutely love this chair!

Review: This Gaming Chair is an absolute game-changer for both gaming and office use. From the moment I sat in it, I knew it was designed with comfort and functionality in mind. The high-back design provides excellent support, allowing me to maintain good posture during long gaming sessions or work hours.One of the standout features is the ergonomic build. The adjustable headrest and lumbar support are perfect for tailoring the chair to your specific needs, ensuring that your back and neck are always properly supported. The reclining function is another great addition, offering a range of angles for relaxation between intense gaming moments or work breaks.The leather material not only gives the chair a sleek, premium look but also makes it easy to clean. The swivel and rolling capabilities are smooth, making it easy to move around your workspace or gaming setup without any hassle. Plus, the chair feels incredibly sturdy and well-built, giving me confidence that it will last for years.Whether you're a gamer looking for comfort during long sessions or someone who needs a reliable office chair for work, this chair delivers on all fronts. Highly recommend it for anyone in need of an ergonomic, stylish, and durable chair.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024

Review: I'm a big believer in "you get what you pay for" and I usually advise to save up, make one purchase, make one investment and don't worry about it for a few years. But something about this chair's value really scales, especially if you can grab it on sale. I got mine in white for $75 including tax and shipping. Many quality gaming chairs cost hundreds of dollars. There a handful of cheap office chairs you can snag for $60. This chair compared to one of those generic office chair is worth the extra $15. If you're looking at this chair for $90 or higher, then the former statement is true (save up). Anyway. I've had this chair for a day now and it isn't perfect. I'll go over what I like and what I don't like.Appearance: It looks nice. Doesn't look or feel too cheap. The base is metal with plastic feet. Many chairs have plastic base with plastic feet.+1ptFunctionality: This chair has a handful of features--You can adjust the height. +1ptBut it only has about a 3in range -1ptIt has a lock to let you remain upright and can be unlocked so you can recline back. +1ptIt does NOT have a way to lock in the reclined position. -1ptComfort: This chair is pretty comfy. It has a removable/adjustable head pillow and a removable/adjustable lumbar pillow as well. +1ptIt is a little stiff. Some people may like that. It also may break it after a while. I've only had it one day so I will update if something new develops. The chair has a *mostly* comfortable width to me. It measures 19" for arm to arm. But it has this little "cushion" that tries to contour your legs that makes it a little uncomfortable to sit with my legs spread even a little. I have to keep my knees closer together than I normally would to keep the "cushion" from digging into the side of my legs. Because of this, there is really only about 16" of room for your butt or the sides of your thighs. I'm about 5'10" Male 215lbs size 38 pants XL shirt. I think I am at the cusp of being able to comfortably sit in this. It was not made with larger people in mind. It does state a 250lb weight limit while we're on the topic. -1ptAssembly: I've assembled several office chairs before and this process was similar and just as easy. +1ptIf you aren't experienced or if you struggle with Ikea stuff, you may find it difficult. The hardware that they include is kinda junk. If you have the luxury of using your own hardware (or hand tools at least), I would highly recommend it. I had one bolt that had really junky threads from the factory and I couldn't do much about it, just had to cross thread it and tighten it the best I could. I had another bolt that stripped and the thread never would grab. Luckily there was one extra included in the packaging and I ended up being able to tighten it without cross threading. I think I got lucky. 90% of the assembly was smooth sailing and the few snags that arose, I knew exactly what to do. Again, if you aren't experienced with this, it could easily turn into a headache and a return to amazon over poor quality hardware
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2023

Review: This chair ticks a lot of boxes that I've had regarding a chair upgrade: Great price, good build and material, comfortable, and looks nice while not being overly gamer nor boring looking. I have a gripe, which is that the assembly is not a 15 minute process. I'm no expert with putting together chairs, tables, etc, however I have taken apart and put back together my PC dozens of times, so I'm no stranger to tinkering with screws, small pieces, and heavy objects. It took me around an hour and a half to fully construct the chair if we include me unpacking everything, and undoing a mistake I made where I mixed up the screws due to the diagram making them look similar in size. Seriously, the instructions make the screws easy to mix up with their similar looking sizes in the pictures. When you hold the screws in your hand, they do look different. Quite different. I believe that it would take 15 minutes for someone highly versed and experienced in building and taking apart furniture, chairs, dressers, etc. Someone that's been doing it for years.In terms of comfort and build, this is unbeatable for the price. Hands down. My old chair was of the mesh variety, and came from the same seller. While it wasn't falling apart, it was quite squeaky and after nearly 3 and a half years of use, I felt like I needed an upgrade. I'm glad I did. This chair oozes comfort. Going from crappy, foamy office chairs, to a decent mesh chair, and then to this is like going from 30fps to 60fps, and then going to 144fps. It's a change that you have to experience to understand. From the armrests, to the overall quality of the backrest, to the cushions supporting your head and lumbar (lower spine), this chair knocks it out of the park.The installation isn't a fast process for everyone. I can understand why these chairs don't come prebuilt, as the size of the box would be much bigger on top of using more cardboard. With that being said, I do hope for a future when installations are plug and play levels of easy. The last thing you want to be after spending a good chunk of money on a new, comfy chair is to be annoyed and thus uncomfortable. Still, I think this is a doable installation for most. I did it in a small room with not much space. I recommend a garage with some space around you, or a living room with some room.

The Ergonomic Office Chair is a sleek and versatile seating solution designed to enhance comfort and productivity in any workspace. Whether you're gaming, working at a desk, or attending virtual meetings, this chair offers exceptional support and style.With its high-back design and built-in lumbar support, the chair promotes proper posture and alleviates back pain, ensuring long hours of seated comfort. The ergonomic features extend to its adjustable armrests and height, allowing users to customize the chair to their specific needs.Crafted with premium materials, including PU leather and a sturdy base, the chair exudes durability and sophistication. Its racing-inspired design adds a touch of flair to any office or gaming setup, making it a statement piece as well as a functional one.Additionally, the chair's swivel and rolling capabilities provide effortless mobility, allowing users to move around their workspace with ease. Whether you need to reach for documents or pivot between screens, the chair facilitates smooth transitions without the need for constant readjustment.Overall, the Ergonomic Office Chair combines comfort, support, and style, making it an excellent choice for individuals seeking relief from back pain and enhanced productivity. Whether you're a professional or a gaming enthusiast, this chair offers the perfect blend of form and function for your daily endeavors.

I purchased this to set up my new office. After combing through the vast selection of other chairs and all the reviews, I decided on this chair and I could not be happier.Before I launch into my assessment of the chair, I just want to say that you should absolutely buy it if you are thinking about purchasing this particular one. I have had many desk chairs of varying prices, sizes, features, etc. and this chair has thoroughly impressed me.Let's start with the assembly, which was so easy and straightforward. I saw some complaints about having a hard time with setting it up, but honestly, just use your brain and all will be ok. I am sure many could set this up without the instructions, which I did until I got to setting up the built-in speakers.I sit in this chair daily for hours and it is SO comfortable. Being able to adjust the back to several different angles is fantastic. The head and lumbar pillows are also great at giving some added support; they never feel like they're in the way. Reclining the chair to its furthest extent offers a very comfortable resting position, and, along with the added foot rest, it truly is a remarkably comfy "recliner" chair. The armrests are adjustable and offer some rotation so you can find the sweet spot for yourself.The built-in speakers are nifty too. **Disclaimer: You must buy the Bluetooth USB Receiver to utilize this feature.** I wasn't expecting much from them, but I do find myself switching to use them for certain entertainment purposes like listening to background music while I work or when I am playing specific games, in particular horror or racing games. The sound is way better than I anticipated, though they do lack bass. The relay unit lasts for hours (days usually for me) and charges quickly enough to never create frustration.Some other notes:-I saw a few complaints about the packaging and indentations created from remaining bundled up in the box. However, I did not experience this at all. All of the cushioned pieces came out of the box well packaged and without blemishes of any kind.-There was an odor initially when taking it out of the box. Ya know, that warehouse smell. After an hour or so, the smell had completely dissipated.-In regards to the Top Critical Review for this chair; That customer is absolutely insane and I cannot fathom what they were expecting for a chair in this price range. I used to have a fancy $980 chair provided from my employer, the largest social media entity. Comparatively, I am far happier with this chair. Yes, there are some plastic parts (dust covers, gas lift cover, armrests) but the expensive chair had the same plastic components. I feel less tension in my lower back after spending 6+ hours in this chair vs the expensive one where I would find myself getting up to walk around every so often to relieve the pain in my lower back. Oh, and they had mentioned missing parts due to the box being damaged (which has no bearing on the product itself); those particular items cannot be lost as they are attached to the chair and in a special pouch located on the back of the chair (see photo). They obviously didn't realize that.All-in-all, this is an excellent purchase for anyone who is looking at a new desk chair. The price is phenomenal for the quality and the amount of features. There is also a good amount of colors to choose from so you can better match your style and decor.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2022

Review: I’ve watched a lot of YT videos of this chair but was hesitant to order online but for $160 how bad could it be?Similar style chairs in Office Max start around $300 but with bonded leather which is commonly known to peel and tear over time.This is PU leather which is not as breathable but sturdy like vinyl without cracking or peeling.First off, assembly is extremely straight forward with incredible step by step instructions.  Hats off to whoever put it together.The seat is surprisingly comfortable and sturdy, as the YT reviews suggested but much more comfortable than I would’ve expected.  I needed a more firm and supportive chair so don’t expect to sink in and be plushy.Every video BASHED the speaker quality comparing it to laptop equivalence. I had low expectations and thought it was more of a gimmick but these are actually louder and having more bass than what YT videos would have you think.  Don’t expect full Bose type quality but for the size of the speakers I would compare it to a smaller JBL flip. These speakers DO NOT distort at high volumes or deep bass (my music of choice is EDM)My only complaint is the foot rest, I wouldn’t pay the money for it.  I’m 5”10 with slightly longer legs than normal and the footrest is more of a calf rest.  My feet hang off and I wish it could come out a few more inches.  The foot rest is not that sturdy and has some give. It’s not well crafted and not really worth using by if you’re under 5’10 than this May suit you well.All in all, exceptional quality, easy to assemble and I would definitely look into this as a really good alternative to the Respawn 110
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022

Overall, this is a great product and I highly recommend.

組み立てに動画と説明書を見ながら2時間以上かかりましたが、楽しかったです。以前から欲しかったので、満足しています。スピーカーも、パソコンで繋げたり、スマホで繋げたりと色々と試しています。

商品の組み立ては説明書通りに作業をしていけば、簡単に組み立てできます。時間の多い、少ないは人によって違うと思いますので参考にはならないと思いますが、自分は２時間程度かかりました。椅子に座った感じは個人個人違うと思いますが、自分にはちょっと硬めに感じました。実は配達になった商品ですが、左のスピーカーに不具合があり、うまく音が出ませんでした。販売元にメールで問い合わせを行ったところ、土曜日だったのですが、すぐに連絡があり、２～３試してもらいたいとのことでした。指示通り試したみたのですが、改善されませんでした。そうするとすぐに「背もたれ」のみ代替え品を送付するとの連絡があり、倉庫が土日休みで月曜日の発送になるとのことでしたが、そのとおり火曜日には代替え品が配達になりました。代替え品は特に問題なく使用できています。品質管理をしっかりといいたいところですが、その後の対応は迅速・丁寧で素晴らしいと感じました。星を４としたのは品質管理の問題で-１です。

Review: It came quickly in the mail within four days. it only took us  30 minutes to assemble it and I didn’t even need the instructions - come on it’s a chair with only a few pieces to assemble lol and it was very easy to follow the directions if you needed to refer back. Of course I am kind of a handy guy with tools, but even if you have a little bit of experience you shouldn’t have a problem putting this chair together there’s really not that many pieces to assemble. I’ve seen people write some reviews saying that they took two hours to figure it out and that’s just ridiculous. It’s really comfortable and fun to use. It has a lot of options like recline, extra padding for lumbar support and neck support and it’s, fully adjustable, and very well-made, and most importantly priced fairly. I’ve seen chairs go for way more and this one is just as good.Im going to get another for office at my garage. It’s so sporty looking! I keep seeing people say this thing breaks? Well, I’m 220lbs and five feet eleven and I didn’t break the foot rest like these other people who must be slam dancing in the chair all night lol come on guys this is a 200 dollar middle of the road chair that’s giving you a lot of nice options and features, AND for a fair price! This isn’t a premium office chair you’ll find in a law firm, bank, or executives conference room, those chairs are usually 1000 dollars folks. I’m also buying the matching desk they make too right after I’m done posting this review. Because I’ve bought many office chairs over the years and I’m having the most fun with this one. And yes, this chair is best fitted for certain “frame types” let’s say, but I’m no small guy and I take care of my stuff that I buy and I’m not rough with it. It’s great for gaming for a few hours and  he’ll yeah as well as kicking back the recline feature and talking on the phone lol I’m so buying another chair for my office at the garage and a desk too! I wanna look cool over there and this chair screams racing!  I don’t care if it lasts only a few years, or maybe it will be last more since I take good care of things,  I’m not using it to go on a ship into outer space with the dam thing! I don’t need a five hundred dollar elite brand chair for my every day work. A buddy of mine has the same chair in his garage with a rough edged floor, grease, and chemicals and he’s had his chair a whole year beating on it and it never broke, I don’t know what these people are doing with the chair but they can’t be treating them correctly. So pound for pound and option for option, this was the best deal going. And anyone who says this chair is less then four stars surely doesn’t know what there talking about. I sat on this chair six hours today and the padding and pillows were satisfactory. Of course my leg was a bit sore because heck, nobody should sit for that long on any chair!lol  But for the money, and the design, I think this chair is just fine.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021

Review: A disaster of a transaction all around and I strongly urge anyone paying attention not to buy this.The building process is awful, screws don't easily go into holes, instructions aren't clear, etc. It took me 5-6 hours to get it built and this is the 4th chair like this I've had so I like to think I know what I am doing.Once built, the 2 most important parts didn't work. The lever for the back of the chair did nothing, thus the back stood straight up with zero give to lean back. Also, the gas canister under the seat part did not work so there as no ability to raise/lower the seat.I took out a 2-year warranty/protection plan thankfully. HOWEVER, ran into more issues with that. The company claimed they sent it, was scheduled for delivery on Feb. 6 arriving independently from the chair. This got delayed until Feb. 8. Then Feb. 9. Finally on Feb. 13 I checked and the tracking number indicated it might be lost.Amazon contacted the company to open a case and have the respond/get me out a new protection plan/paperwork but instead of discussing and doing this the VERY QUICKLY canceled my 2-year protection plan and issued a refund without even consulting me.So, for a brief while, I had a defective chair that did not work at all and no protection plan to apply for a refund.Thankfully, Amazon took care of it and refunded me everything but urged me to write this.I suspect this company is a scam. The price of the chair is so low for a reason. Cause it's a bad product that doesn't work well. The company knows this, they know most won't take out a warranty for such a cheap item. I did, which had them worried so they quickly canceled/refunded it once they knew I had an issue with the chair and would want to use this warranty for a refund.BUYER BEWARE

A friend of mine has an $800 gaming chair which is really cool and super comfortable. This chair looked similar and was only $150 so I decided to give it a try. Is it as good as that $800 gaming chair? No. Definitely not. But it's still a comfortable chair that I like more than the chair I was using.I like the material. It's soft and feels good on my bare skin. I had to put armrest covers on my other chair because the hard plastic would irritate my forearms. No need for those on this chair. The seat, back, arms, and headrest are all covered with this material, whatever it is, and padded with a dense foam underneath. The lumbar pad offers nice back support and the headrest is quite comforting. I also like that the main support post is higher off the ground than any of my other office chairs by a couple inches.The back reclines and locks in place at whichever angle you desire, which is really cool. Unfortunately, it reclines too easily for me. There isn't enough resistance. I think that's my one major gripe, but even that's not too bad. I locked it in at a certain angle and have been okay with that. Still, I wish they would have made the resistance adjustable like all my other office chairs.So I guess I should get into some of the downsides, all of which are pretty minor. The armrest height is not adjustable. For me, that's fine as they're already at the perfect height. It comes with a leg rest thing which I found to be uncomfortable. The edge of it hits my legs at just the wrong place. I've never used one of these before and not even sure why I would want to. The lumbar pillow just sits on the seat, it doesn't connect in any way. In my friend's $800 chair this and the headrest both connect via magnets. The headrest on this attaches via elastic band.For $150 this is a very nice chair. It's no $800 chair but it looks nice and is comfortable on the butt, back, arms, and head.

First off, shipping was extremely fast. I was to assemble it in less than 20 minutes because the instructions are clear, concise and easy to follow. It feels sturdy and safe. I often find office chairs don't feel completely stable especially when leaning back. But with this chair, even at the advertised 170 degrees, it doesn't feel as if it will tip or break. The frame and parts that required assembly also felt sturdy and hefty. At 6'2 and 200 lbs, I feel comfortable and stable. So far, my back and shoulders feel better just after a couple days of use. It definitely helps keep my posture healthy and it is a comfortable chair. I love motorsports and currently have a bucket seat in my own project car. This chair feels very similar and gives me a sense of familiarity. (Obviously a little different due to it being a chair and not a driver seat.) I thought the faux leather would be awful but considering it is faux leather, its actually amazing. It doesn't FEEL or LOOK cheap. In fact with the stitched logo on the headres and the clean tight stitching throughout the whole product, it looks clean and stylish. And if all the reviews of great customer service are true, I don't even feel worried that if it were to break in some way, I wouldn't be able to get help. Overall, this chair, for the price, is amazing.

Review: This GTRACING Gaming Chair has definitely stood the test of time! Not only has it held up perfectly, but it’s also comfortable and supportive even during long hours of use. It’s been through a lot, including supporting a 300lb man, and it’s still as sturdy as the day I bought it. The backrest and overall construction are solid, and the padding hasn’t flattened at all. Review: I noticed that the instructions were very easy to follow; I never got confused about anything and never had to redo anything. Review: I have tested quite a few more expensive gaming chairs in stores but this one is the one that wins out. I solely went with the reviews without trying first and I'm glad I did.Quick thoughts:- i had no issues with holes aligning upon assembly.-Instructions are good and easy to follow.-quality was better than I assumed.-comfort is decent for me (medium build sub 200lbs.)-overall I'm happy with my purchase, keep in mind I am not in the chair for longer than an hour to 2 hours at a time nor everyday for that matter.  But my last chair was used the same amount of time and was not comfortable)After a month or 2 i would recommend this for casual use and the price).- i researched alot of chairs and saw in many youtube videos where its suggested to buy a good office chair but I suggest the opposite.The hyken chair is often suggested and i personally don't get why. I sat in it and instantly didn't think it was comfortable. This is a superior chair in my opinion. Hope this helps someone.I will update if any issues arise.UPDATE* 5 months after purchase, I still like my chair but the creaking developed after 1 month like others had suggested. Not a big deal to me as everything else is still working well, knock on wood.UPDATE**2After 1 year and 1 month everything is still good with the chair. Minor creaking persists but I barely pay attention to it. I havent attempted to see if i could address it either. Still functions great and I would buy again. I was worried that the white colored pleather material would yellow but it hasn't and still looks like it did the day I bought it.

Review: Purchased this for my husband for Christmas a few years ago. It gets lots of use and still looks brand new. It’s easy to clean. Review: I received this chair two days early, and I assembled it in ~1hr by myself. The instructions included with the chair are very detailed and easy to read. Now for a pros and cons list:Pros:-Very easy to assemble-Good Instructions-Sturdy Build-Seat cushion is amazingly comfortable (much better than my previous chair)-The reclining backrest is amazing!-The armrests are fun to play with-The casters are high quality and roll easily, even on carpet (a little harder to move than on tile/wood floor.)-The elevation mechanism has a great height range (great for higher desks such as custom ones like mine)-Doesn't cost $400+!!!Cons:-Lumbar support cushion was pretty stiff (made me feel like I was constantly bending my back the wrong way)-Some holes were slightly misaligned as I found during construction-Letters on the head pillow are slightly abrasive for a guy with short hair-Armrests are a little far out from the chairOverall, this is an amazing chair for the price, and this is one that will likely last for a long while. If you are looking for a racing chair that isn't super expensive, buy this one. It's great.

Chair is sturdy enough, but the seat has a slight forward tilt which make it incredibly uncomfortable. I passed it on to my wife who has also rejected it then passed it on to my son who is also complaining about the seat. I would not recommend buying.

Review: The chair is absolutely gorgeous! I bought 3, one for each member of my household. My brothers are 6’+ with an athletic build. Both have raved about how comfortable and supportive the chairs are.Pros:+ The seat cushion is thick and comfortable. Sitting for hours is no problem+ Back support is top tier no matter your height. I am 5’5”. The back support for me is great, and my brothers say it is great for them as well.+ The headrest attachment adjust up and down as well as the actual headrest can be moved so you can find the perfect angle for your head to rest. This was a huge plus for us.+ The fabric is breathable so I don’t find myself getting hot like I do in my Corsair gaming chair+ VERY easy assembly, very intuitive.+ Made of great materials+ Adjustable arm rests fits underneath my standing deskCons+ Wheels are not hardwood safe. They will scratch most surfaces so I bought a set of office chair wheels that are hardwood safe; they went right into the base with no issue (easy to swap out if needed)+ color of the arm rests with the gray chair. For some reason, the color of the arm rests are the same no matter what color you get. Looks great with the white and black chairs I bought, but looks a bit off with the all gray and white desk chairOverall these cons are very small. The chairs are amazing. We love them. The customer service is also great. It was easy to activated the 1yr warranty.

Review: I personally love this chair – so far at least! It was easy to put together, seems really sturdy (especially given the price), and is comfortable. I work from home so having a good chair to sit on for 7+ hours a day is very important. This chair lived up to that need and seems to be a really good purchase. I do love that the chair is firm, but not too hard and the back is mesh so you don’t get too hot. It does also have a head rest, and leans back for added comfort. The arm rests to move so you can adjust as needed, and you can also higher or lower the chair. Overall, I would recommend this to someone looking for a good chair at a good price. If you are using it on carpet – I do recommend a mat as it is hard to move on carpet but you would have that with any chair.

Review: I recently purchased the Winrise Office Chair, and I must say, it has exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I unboxed it, I was impressed with the straightforward assembly process. The instructions were clear and concise, making installation a breeze. Within minutes, I had a sleek, ergonomic chair ready for use.The comfort level of this chair is noticeable right away. As someone who spends long hours at a desk, both for work and during gaming sessions, the Winrise Chair has been a game changer. The high back design and lumbar support cradle my spine perfectly, providing relief and support where it's needed most. The breathable mesh back is a standout feature, ensuring I stay cool and comfortable even during intense, long-lasting use.The adjustable armrests are a thoughtful addition, allowing me to customize the chair to my body's needs, further enhancing the comfort and ergonomic benefits. The chair's ability to recline is also a huge plus, offering me the flexibility to lean back and relax between tasks or during game breaks.In summary, the Winrise Office Chair is a top-tier choice for anyone in need of a comfortable, ergonomic chair that is not only easy to install but also provides substantial support for both office work and gaming. It's a worthy investment for the wellbeing of your back and overall posture. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a big and tall reclining comfy home office chair that truly delivers on its promises. Five stars all the way!
Date: Reviewed in the United Arab Emirates on December 6, 2023

Review: This chair is great overall. It’s not at the level of a Herman Miller, but it still offers comfortably seating with convincing quality. It has both pros and cons.Pros: (1) Easy to assemble. It took me around 30 mins to put everything together (see Figure 1). During assembly, I noticed that the material and build quality of the chair are excellent, also the bolts were always aligned. (2) The chair itself is comfortable with great support for the back and neck. The mesh material is very breathable, which makes it less likely to cause sweating. (3) The armrest is soft and height adjustable.Cons: (1) The armrest cannot be changed horizontally(front and back). Since the armrest is pretty short, it is not very comfortable unless you sit very close to the back. (2) The back material could be improved, it’s a little bit uncomfortable when tilting and lying on the back. (3) Not exactly a con, but I wish this chair had a lever to completely disable the tilting. My old chair has this feature, and I found it very helpful.
It is a good product. Worth buying it.

I’ve been using the Win Rise Ergonomic Office Chair for a few weeks, and it’s made a world of difference in my comfort and productivity. The lumbar support is fantastic, and I love how adjustable everything is—from the armrests to the seat height. It’s also very sturdy and built with quality materials, so I know it will last for years. The ergonomic design really helps with posture and reduces back strain during long workdays. Assembly was a breeze, and for the price, I think this chair is an excellent investment for anyone who spends a lot of time at their desk."

Have used this chair for 3 months now. Seat was half an inch higher on left side than the right side, and yes it is definitely noticable when sitting. It's likely due to their poor QA not ensuring that the frame under the foam was completely even and uniform.I also have concerns about the lifespan of the foam. Not sure how long it can stay soft before it becomes more compressed.UPDATE: Seller has reached out and offered to replace my seat foam for free. This should fix the uneven seat problem. Great customer service makes this a safe purchase.

Not a major issue at all but it seems like it is designed for someone bigger than me.

I'm so impressed with the quality of this chair. My boyfriend is also very impressed with it, he is a seasoned gamer. He will be buying his next gaming chair from this brand. This chair can easily compete with more expensive chairs when it comes to quality and comfort. It seems to be a European brand which I love. It is very sturdy and the material is easy to clean. Assembled the chair by myself and had no issues, the instructions were very clear. The foam is high density. It seems a bit stiff at first but is extremely comfortable even after using it for a couple of hours. It's very easy to take a nap in the chair. The lumbar pillow so nice. It just vibrates which felt weird at first but is pretty nice after a while. I really like how the cushion unzips from the back, this is where I tuck in the cord when not in use. The only thing I don't like about the chair is how the cat plushie that clips to the side just hangs and won't sit on the side of the chair as shown in photos. Not a big complaint, easy to fix with a bit of Velcro.I'm so glad I bought this chair. If you are thinking about getting this product you need to buy it. Please keep in mind, it is slightly smaller than your average gaming chair. I'm 5'2" and fit perfect with the head rest pillow attached when the back rest is positioned all the way up. Any taller and it would probably be a bit awkward. If you are taller and are taking the pillow off anyway, no concern. Had a full grown man at 6'3" sit in it with the chair fully reclined, he was very comfortable but barely fit.

Review: So I am sitting in this chair the majority of the day. I stream, and also do online homeschool for my kids and other stuff on my pc so Im sitting in it most of the time I am awake. I had a gaming chair from office depot that was like 60 bucks and decided to make the investment to get a new chair after 2 years and here is my opinion of it.1. It was fairly easy to put together. Instructions sucked but it was self explanatory for the most part2. Very cute. My gaming set up is black and pink ghostface themed and I also love cats so it was perfect3. The massager is okay. Its just typical vibrations but I dont use it a whole lot4. I am mostly a pc gamer so I dont have a bunch of games where I can recline it and use the footstool but Ive used it a few times while watching shows. The footstool seems sturdy but it doesnt go out super far so I feel a bit scrunchedand lastly 5. Im not sure if its because its new but my back has been killing me since I got this chair and have been having to take breaks and stretch. I also dont believe its a great chair for thick girly or guys. I have decent sized thighs and it has these pieces on the butt of the chair that I believe are metal bars underneath the material and the back of my thighs are so sore from constantly being on them so Im looking into a seat cushion to see if that'll help.And one last thing, the arm rests dont come up very high. They sit about hip level and my old chair they came up and met my arm when I would game so its been a learning curve how to hold my arms now.Otherwise, good chair, not sure if I believe its worth the $200 but its a good chair overall

Review: If you aren’t a particularly strong person (I am not), you’ll either need some extra help putting the arms of the base on, or you’ll need to figure out a safe way to use your body weight as leverage pulling them into place. They’re HARD to pull on right, but they definitely won’t budge after they’re on. It’ll also help having another person to hold up the back rest for a minute getting the screw into place attaching it to the backplate. Everything else is incredibly straight-forward and the instructions have both visual and descriptive guides. Also translated into three languages (German, English, and Japanese).The chair itself is SURPRISINGLY comfortable. I hate firm cushions and I was worried this would just feel hard, but it doesn’t. It just feels really supportive in a very pleasant way. It also helps that the height/angles of everything feel absolutely perfect for me (I’m 5’6.5”). And it’s SO CUTE!! I didn’t attach the ears, but I love the design and the color scheme. The blue is a very green-leaning pastel blue, which I’m very happy with. The materials of the cushions are faux leather for the blue, and faux suede for the white. Both are super soft and I love it. The fact that it’s a fully reclining office chair just sends it over the top for me; I wanted a chair I could fully stretch out in because I’d been really cramped in my desk setup til now, and it’s such a nice upgrade from a stationary accent chair to an actual office/gaming chair. You have to extend the footrest manually, but frankly, I don’t care; it works fine and adds so much to the comfort. 10/10 would recommend you buy

Review: Best purchase ever, wished I’ve done so sooner. I have used my old Walmart mainstay futon bed/couch for many years and it has started to get uncomfortable as the futon slowly sinks into the springs. That’s when I looked up Amazon and saw this chair with everything I wanted without the $300+ price tag for a chair. I didn’t want a wheeled PC type gamer chair, nor the massage chair stuff. I just wanted a swivel recliner with a cup holder on the left side and not break the bank. (Yes, I want my cup holder on the left. I am right handed btw) This chair had everything I wanted and not more and it’s in my budget. You can buy a lower back  Massager separately for less than $30 if you really wanted one, but didn’t want to pay the $400 tags.It’s very EASY to install by yourself, maybe spend extra 2 mins trying to align up the bottom seat cushion with the chair back for the two screws to hold it up right. The box only have 5 big parts to put this chair together. The chair leg/platform, chair cushions&leg rest, chair back, and the two arm rests.The tool kit gives you one extra of every bolt/screw/washer for the chair, in case you end up loosing one somehow. They’re also all lightly tip dipped with blue lock tight, so you don’t have to worry about them loosen out over time.(How I got it done under 20mins with no help)1. Open everything and set them up in a organized fashion so you can count inventory, making sure you have everything you need.2. Follow the REALLY simple instructions step by step!  This is a lot easier than majority of the IKEA instructions!3. When putting the bottom chair cushion into the bottom swivel rod, it won’t just plop down onto the rod. You’ll have to just wiggle the chair side to side, and let gravity slowly sink the chair on to the rod. It helps when you unzip the fabric to see the alignment/pic included.4. Don’t over tighten all the screws/bolts/etc all the way till you’re actually done putting it together. As some adjustments might be needed.5. When installing arm rests, just slap it down on the side of the chair, and line it up to the metal bracket for the holes underneath/don’t forget the washers! , if it’s not lined up, give it a few light slaps to get it to line up. Easy Peezy. I spent less than 15mins total which  included inventory count and unwrapping everything, and putting this together by myself.SO got sad that I didn’t ask for help at all, like lifting it up stairs.I bought chair in the USED-like new, I guess it’s due to that single cut by the bottom left arm rest/pic included, so I spent even less than the price tag for nearly 99% new, huzzah!Though the box it came in has seen better days. It looked like it went through 2 Black Friday events/tape everywhere to keep the box together. But everything was plastic wrapped and foam sheet wrapped protected. It was easy to carry upstairs as it felt less than 58lbs to me/IMO.The comfort of the chair can be on par with those nice leather movie theater chairs, just not the plush ones. I’ve gamed and Netflix binged for hours and this chair gave me all the comfort i needed. I’m 5,7 and my ankle just hangs over the feet rest/I like it that way. Of course the chair will do a loud clunk sound when the gears lock into place when you put your feet rest up. This ain’t a $700 lazy-boy chair!  Thus the ‘clunk’ noise doesn’t bug me at all.Here’s some measurements I took myself for the chair, if anyone have questions on certain areas like I did for myself.Chair cushion width is about 18.5-19inChair cushion Length is 22in before it bends for the foot rest.Foot rest length without chair cushion is 14in.If you add the seat cushion with leg rest it’s 35.5in total in length/it’s slightly curved.Chair is about 13.5 in off the floor at the lowest point/near the chair backChair is about 17in off the floor at where you knees bend. It inclines lower towards the back of the chair.Chair back without adding in the sides are 11in.Chair back with the sides added are 19in at where it curves inward.Chair back at widest/shoulder is 22inChair back head rest/top of the chair not the pillow are 12.5in.Chair arm rests are 20.5in x 6inNeck Pillow are 12in x 6in. Avg 3.75in thick.You have about 3.75in for the neck pillow height adjustment on the back of the chair.There’s no separate lower back support/massage pillow if you’re looking for those.Cup holder are 3.25in width and 2.5in deep, it’s a one piece plastic tube, no worry of liquids leaking into the chair.Side pouch Can expand up to 3+in, 5-5.5in width, and the length is shortest at 5.5in, and 6.5in at the longest. There’s a separator sewed in the pouch so you have 2 compartments in that pouch.BTW The box it came in is quite huge and might need a buddy to help you lift it.It’s 38.5inL x 28inW x 16.5inH. At 58-60lbs with the box included.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020

Review: I spend all day in the chair considering I work at the same desktop I game at. So I spend much of my time in this chair. I also want to add that I exceed the 'weight capacity limit,' by over 40lbs and I've had no issues. I've had this chair roughly 1.5 months. Slight looseness at the base but that's because of the little park that you sit on and it's adjusting. Cannot feel the bar that is under my thighs that some people complained of feeling. The arms are well cushioned and everything is memory foam, so when you lift your arm up, and up, or whatever the foam returns it its original design and allows for continual support.Unlike some reviews I've had no physical issues with the chair itself, no breaking, tearing, misplaced anything. It was very easy to put together, very comfortable to sit in, and I'm like I said before 40lbs heavier than the weight capacity. I believe most people are dishonest, abuse the chair and then blame the manufacturer. I however, am very happy with the purchase. Game on!The pillow is to my upper back, I am 6'6" and for tall people the chair will definitely feel a little small, but the back support and the head portion goes all the way to the top of my head, sometimes I remove the pillow and strap a neck massager on there! Overall I would recommend it, my brother is moving into a new house and asked if I knew of a good gaming chair, I would recommend this in a heartbeat. Being as it's on a swivel, it's a recliner, it has the extra pouch on the side for my Steam controller and some batteries, and a few cans of dip! A cup holder for my beverage and very comfortable for many hours of office work and/or gaming. I recommend this product.EDIT: Little update, it does develop a slight wobble within 1-month of use, but it does not get progressively worse from what I can tell. It just remains a little loose in the stand, you can go down below and see where the issue is, just jam paper or metal in there if it bothers you.Attached a photo of my game/work setup and the chair displayed so beautifully in the front!Edit: After 6 months of use the left arm mid portion that has a different mesh design has decided to start curling up, cracking and falling off. I notice this is attributed to how people stand up; many people use the chair they’re sitting on as a point to push themselves up. I learned to stop doing that and just use my damn legs. Fixed the issue from getting worse.The first month I had it, it started to wobble at the base. It still does, bud you can fix it, just slide wood or metal or paper even inside the area where the chair piston connects to the base. It’s just once it settles there’s a slice give that allows it to move. It’s only noticeable when you move around.Still worth $300? I think so. It’s still a damn good chair regardless the little things that most people (users) are to blame for.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020

EDIT on 08-09-2020:I have uploaded some pictures of the chair, to show you how it looks like 5 years later, after some regular uses. For the price, getting 5 years out of this chair was actually nice. But now it's time for a new one though.ORIGINAL REVIEW:Chair assembled on 02/11/2015Yup, for the price this chair is indeed quite nice. It has a small back, so it doesn't have the long "high" back rest that some of the high end desk chair I've seen around. Which was perfect for me, since my space around my desk is quite limited.Good padding in the back and siting area too. Although, some people may find it not enough still. In such case, there are plenty of vendor that will offer you here some extra cushioning accessories. About cushioning, from the pictures I was expecting this chair to have a little more padding on its arm-rest, which it didn't sadly. There is some padding, but I can feel still the hard plastic through the padding with my elbow. But again not a big deal, since I already have some extra arm-rest padding I bought previously for my other (old) chair.Assembly is SUPER easy and straight forward too. It took me only 20mn alone to mount it together. They even give you some spare hardware just in case you break something during the assembly. I have uploaded some photos here of the assembly steps for you to check. You can also see the box the chair comes in.Also something I was quite please with, was the fact the screws felt strong when tightening them in place. Some other chair I had just had some of their screws spinning freely at some point, once I forced too much on the tightening process. But not this chair though. All nice and tight now.Once assembled, the chair feels nice and is definitely comfortable. The "fake" leather material is nice and shiny right now, but we will see how it holds up after sitting on that chair after a year though. If anything happen, I will definitely come and update this review. For now, I am going to do some gaming, enjoying that really cool chair !

Review: I sit in this chair every single day to do homework from college, it holds up very well. It was incredibly easy to put together, I had it together by myself in less than 10 minutes. All my handles and gadgets work perfectly. It's a very easy chair to fall in love with, it takes a couple of sits to really break it in and not feel stiff. The leather is really nice and seems to be of high quality. It's a very expensive looking chair and it's extremely comfortable. I usually have a lot of lower back problems and I sit quite nicely in this chair for long periods of time.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2015

Review: I bought two of these chairs and initially they appeared to be fairly easy to put together. Once it came to attaching the arms, the trouble began. On the first chair, one of the screws was messed up but fortunately there is an extra provided. Also, I changed the order of assembly by attaching the seat plate before attaching the arms. That made much more sense. Please also consider fully exposing the screw holes on the seat and on the back. The foam gets in the way of inserting the screw, otherwise. I stretched the upholstery around the holes on the seat and the back to accommodate insertion of the screws.As far as function, the chair's height adjustments are adequate for both my husband (6ft tall) and myself (5ft 4 inches tall). The tilt function of the chair is incredibly subtle. I really can't tell the difference either way. The cushioning is nice. The faux (fake!) leather looks nicer than it is and feels of greater quality as well.Bottom line: For approximately $100 this chair is nice. Always remember > you get what you pay for. I work from home one day a week. My husband uses his chair to game on his PC and he spends probably 40 hours a week doing so. This chair is better than the dining room chair he was using for this purpose.UPDATE:18 months later these chairs are still working great. I'm now working from home 3 days a week. This chair is more comfortable than the one in my office.UPDATE:It is now July 2019 and this chair is still holding up perfectly. Since my last update I have a dedicated home office and began working from home almost exclusively. The leather upholstery is still in great shape and all the parts are still attached.  I remain in love with my chair and it is still very comfortable.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2016

Review: I will not recommend this chair unless you consider yourself extra handy. In later version of this chair, it uses low quality nuts and bolts which are very difficult to tighten up correctly. It is not in the design where the nut locations are correctly mounted. But the nuts and bolts have very tight fit and rough surface making them difficult to go in. Once the bolt starts correctly, it will go in alright. If not careful, you can ruin the thread and the chair. That's why you see reviews saying both that the chair is easy (design) and difficult (parts quality) to assemble. I spent more than an hour to put in the 8 bolts for the seat, back and arm rest. I highly recommend a bottle of petroleum jelly and a M5 size T-handled hex key (not provided with the chair) for the assembly task.The chair has some padding all around, but the foam pieces are not thick and low quality. I am only 170 pounds and the seat foam bottoms out when I sat on it. If you sit on the chair all day long, invest in a chair with thick high quality memory foam and expect to spend upward of $300. For shorter work session, the chair is reasonably comfortable for its price. When assembled, the chair is stable and sturdy.This chair is for smaller build person.

After putting this chair together, and reading a bunch of reviews, I think I can offer a suggestion or two on assembly.  Reviews have stated problems with debris in the screw holes, I had that too.  So b4 you get started, just take a minute and go through all the holes, clean them out,  and make sure the leather is out of the way as much as possible.  Next is install all the screws, ALMOST all the way in, don't tighten any of them until after they are all installed, then tighten them up.  If you tighten as you go, you may find yourself fighting to get another piece to line up the screw hole to where it's supposed to go.I too feel like it's tilted too far forward when it's in it's natural position, but I just set the tension of the recline knob really loose and that makes it easy to tilt back.  It might not be the answer for everyone, but it worked for me.I bought this chair approx. nine months ago, and now I have a problem.  This chair is rated for people 250lbs. or less.  I am much less than that.  The gas piston which holds the chair a set height won't do it's job anymore.  There have been times where the seat would completely collapse to it's lowest position and I have only begun to sit down.  This is not good for anyone's back, that's for sure.  I have tried to reach the seller, and got nowhere.  I tried Amazon (via chat) and got nowhere as well.  I am past the return date, but I don't want to return the chair, I would just like to have that piston replaced, the rest of the chair is fine, I actually like it except for that one issue.  The only reason I am writing now is to warn people this chair will not do what the ad says it will do, and you might be better off not buying this one.

I had a gaming chair which I found uncomfortable. Sitting on this the first it felt uncomfortable but once the cushion soften up it gotten much more comfortable. I am enjoying sitting on this chair for my entire work hours. I had one issue which was the pneumatic cylinder dropping the chair height out of nowhere. I reached to customer service and received a replacement.I wouldn't recommend this chair for anyone big and tall. It can handle weight 250lbs and less

***Update On Review***This chair has without a doubt been one of the best purchases I ever made on Amazon. It was the first piece of furniture I purchased that was not "budget" -- I bought it because I had gained a lot of weight and fell outside the OSHA guidelines for most economy model purchases.I'm happy to say I've lost a lot of weight. I'm even happier to say that the chair has been excellent. Build, durability, comfort, and quality have all remained exceptional. If this chair breaks, I would replace it with the same item if I could.I'm a very large guy -- 5'11", 275 pounds, with a broad build. I'm 37 and probably won't be able to get much smaller in my middle age, so I decided to invest in a chair that would be worth sitting in when working from home. I did my research and considered multiple options. I reviewed several items after browsing the web and came to Amazon after reviewing suggestions from bigandtallfurniture dot com. This chair was the best balance of price and accommodation on their recommendation list.I just received this chair and let me tell you that it already appears to be a gamechanger. Previously, I have only ever purchased budget office chairs from big box stores (so if you're a good chair connoisseur YMMV). This was the first time I decided to pay premium dollar for an office chair, and the difference over those $60-100 chairs available from Target is already clear.First of all, the dimensions are much more comfortable. My previous two office chairs from a big box store were each 18" long by 19.5" wide. This chair is 22" long by 22" wide. That is a significant amount of extra real estate and it is noticeable immediately. This is the first office chair I've owned that actually gives me wide enough room to sit comfortably. I can even sit cross-legged in this chair although I have to do have lotus position (one leg on top of the other). This chair is definitely wider than a standard airline seat, for reference.Next up, I am a fan of the build. The chair components are much heavier than their budget counterparts from a big box store. The chair feels sturdy and substantial after construction. It is certainly a weightier chair and I feel like it will easily support me. The mesh back will also cool more easily than a bonded leather back will.Now to the features. Like a budget office chair, this has an adjustable height. Unlike budget office chairs, this has a thick cushion, adjustble armrests (height AND width), and adjustable lumbar support. The lumbar support is a nice touch that didn't factor in my decision but I already suspect will be a welcome addition.Construction was easy If you can lift 50 pounds. I used the box as a platform for attaching the arms, back, and base to the seat cushion. It required screwing in 16 total allen wrench bolts and that was the step that took the longest, but all of the slots lined up well and the provided allen wrench was big enough to make screwing relatively easy.I am excited to own this chair. I am looking forward to frequent daily use, at least until I can go back to in-person teaching in Fall 2021. If any components break or deteriorate, I will update. But I'm cautiously optimistic that this chair will satisfy my needs for a few years to come. Here's hoping!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021

Review: Holy fat man! This chair is the best chair I have ever purchased for my home. It is very similar in quality as the sort of furniture you see in a well appointed office. It is very well made. It is comfortable. And my 375 hulking mass does not even seem to strain it. The last office chair I bought broke the center pedestal hydraulics in under two weeks of use. It was small as all get out, smaller than what I normally see in a real office at a major corporation in the cubicles of the drones. It was sort of comfortable in an uncomfortable way.This new chair is a *real* chair and not one of those cheepos you get at Office Depot for $34.99. It does what it is supposed to, it has a decent amount of adjustability, and fat beggars cannot afford to be choosers. This works, does not hurt my butt or lower back, is more than roomy enough, and the casters are smooth and strong.I was worried about dripping $300 on a stinking CHAIR for my computer desk, but this was absolutely worth every penny to both me and my largish wife (sorry, honey). Recommended.NOTE: The Allen key included with the hardware package, as is the norm for single-used trash tools, is a genuine POS. Use a long Allen key if you have a set. I cannot remember offhand which I used, so get both your metric and your SAE sets. These screws all have a Loctite-type of dried blue stuff on them. It is hard to turn them in after a few threads. The four that hold the base to the seat are LONG and will require you to whale on that Allen key for some time. Because of this I recommend you use heavy gloves when assembling this. Also, this is why you need to use a LONG Allen key if you have one. It will give you a LOT more leverage than the short one that is included. Also, this is a heavy chair. The box was like 64 pounds and the parts can be hard to lift if you are sitting on the floor to assemble this. Finally, my casters never did "click" or "snap" into place; the instructions tell you to listen and feel for this engagement. The holes in the base are partially packed with grease and there was NO feedback to let us know the casters were locked in place. I had my wife stand on the base with one foot (placing it on carpet and a towel to make sure it did not shoot out from beneath her) and this seemed to drive the castes home. Or home enough. ;-)Great chair. If you are a big boy like me and are tired of junky chairs that cannot hold your weight or are uncomfortably small, this is something to consider, despite the price.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2016

Review: TL;DRReasonably comfy, seat cushion is quite firm, lumbar support surprisingly good, very solid build, easy to put together, is quite heavy.WHY I BOUGHT THISI bought this chair because  I am 6'3" (190cm) with long legs, and I work as a computer programmer. My previous chair had me sitting with very bad posture, and knees and neck were really starting to feel the pain. I saw that this chair featured on numerous top ten lists for big-and-tall office chair.WHAT TO KNOWThe distance from the floor to the top of the chair where your butt goes is large. My 5'7" (170cm) wife's feet do not touch the floor at its lowest setting.[SETUP] When attaching the seat back to the base, turn the seat upside down on an armless chair, adjusting the height with pillows, till the flat piece of the chair back and the screw-holes on the base line up. You'll see what I mean. Will make your life easier.It is quite heavy. I may have done well to carry it up the stairs in pieces to where I am using it.WHAT ELSEI splurged and got myself better chair caster wheels that are rollerblade wheels. I recommend you do the same.I personally do not like arm rests and did not install the ones the chair with.WHAT'S NEXTI will update this review later for comfort. I am still getting used to it.  For now, it seems to be promoting better posture -- my back is naturally upright and my feet are flat on the floor with my knees bent at a good angle which i could not get with my previous chair. I may now have to see about getting monitor stands to raise up my screens.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021

Review: I bought this chair because I was tired of dents on the sides of my thighs from my old, rather basic office chair.  This chair is wonderfully wide--definitely well designed for those blessed in the hips!  The cushion is quite firm, but I actually like that.  I am 5' 8" tall, but most of my height is in my legs.  My feet are flat on the ground at the lowest setting--I think the chair would not work for anyone shorter, or for those who have shorter legs for their height.  My only complaint about the chair is that the back does not adjust, and its position is a bit too reclined for my taste.  I like to sit very upright, so for most people this probably wouldn't be an issue.One hint about putting it together...definitely use an armless chair or stool to support the seat as you are screwing the parts together.  It is not a difficult assembly, but the chair is quite heavy (66 pounds!) so it really does need a support.  I also agree with the reviewers who recommended a longer Allen key if you have one, and a pair of gloves.  There is a fair amount of torque necessary to get the bolts in tightly.  Also, don't put the arms on backwards!  Not my brightest moment ;)

I purchased this product as I was looking for chair that would be a comfortable height for someone that is over 6'8". Initially I was thrilled. The chair was comfy, looked nice, and most importantly my knees no longer hurt from being to low to the ground.However, 3 months later, at the time I am writing this review the chair suspension has totally given out, and will no longer rise past the lowest it can go. On the rare occasion it does, putting any weight on it will cause it to sink back down to the floor immediately. For a chair that cost over $400cad at the time of purchase, for it to break this quickly is unacceptable. I was looking forward to using it for many years to come, but now it is completely unusable.
We received a different chair and it took weeks to arrive. We'll keep it since it took so long, but beware it's BO.
