Review: Description:Type: Ergonomic Desk ChairDesign: High Back Gaming Chair, AdjustableColor: BlackFeatures: Breathable Mesh, Lumbar Support, Reclining FunctionFeatures:4D Adjustable Armrests: Armrests can be adjusted in four directions—up/down, forward/backward, and pivot—to find the most comfortable position.High Back Design: Provides full back support, which is ideal for extended sitting periods.Reclining Function: Chair can be reclined to various angles for relaxation or comfort during breaks.Lumbar Support: Built-in lumbar support to help reduce back strain and promote good posture.Breathable Mesh Material: Keeps you cool and comfortable by allowing air to circulate.Big and Tall: Designed to accommodate larger and taller users with ample support and stability.Benefits:Enhanced Comfort: Ergonomic design and adjustable features ensure comfort for long hours of sitting.Improved Posture: Lumbar support and high back design help maintain proper posture and reduce back pain.Versatility: Suitable for office work, gaming, or home use with its adjustable and reclining features.Cooling Effect: Breathable mesh material helps to keep you cool and comfortable.Usage:Office Work: Ideal for professionals who spend long hours at a desk and need a comfortable and supportive chair.Gaming: Provides comfort and support for extended gaming sessions with its reclining and adjustable features.Home Use: Suitable for use in a home office or study area, offering ergonomic support and comfort.Care Instructions:Cleaning: Wipe the mesh surface with a damp cloth to remove dust and spills. Avoid using harsh chemicals.Maintenance: Regularly check and adjust the chair’s components to ensure proper functionality. Tighten any loose screws or bolts.Gift Idea:Ideal For: Perfect for anyone who spends a lot of time at their desk, whether for work, study, or gaming. A great gift for professionals, students, or gamers who need a comfortable and supportive chair.

Review: I Thoroughly researched all available options of chairs in this price range according to my list of ergonomic needs. The 4D armrests were on the top of my priority list, an extremely comfortable cushion was next, headrest, rocking, lumbar, etc.I was Sold on the pictures of the extra swivel functions of the armrests. But there is nothing to lock them in Place so you can actually Lean on them!! They swing right open to the sides as soon as you apply any pressure! So pointless and frustrating. Its almost like not having armrests at all because they are so far apart! The only way i could see it being any benefit is if you are a very large-sized person and normally have issues fitting in between fixed armrests.. (but even then, there are better, wider 'big and tall' chairs out there in the same price range.)I added a star in the rating because it isn't the worst chair out there, but certainly nothing special, and such a letdown in my experience. The setup was fine/simple, but in the end, I had to make the effort to deconstruct it, squeeze it back in the box, and take it to get it shipped back.

Review: This was packaged nicely so everything arrived in great condition. Review: I've been using the LarkLeaves Office Chair for a few dayss now, and here's my take on it.Design: The design of the LarkLeaves Office Chair is sleek and modern. It fits well into a home office space. The build feels solid with a well-crafted frame and a fine back. It’s not just functional but also an aesthetic piece that complements the home office environment nicely.Comfort: This chair is super comfortable. The seat cushion is made from high-density foam, which provides firm but comfortable support even during long hours of sitting. The lumbar support is adjustable, which is a nice touch for people who need that extra support for their lower back.Assembly: Assembling the chair was fairly straightforward, taking about 20–30 minutes. The instructions were clear, and all necessary tools were included in the package. The parts seemed sturdy and well-made, and the assembly process didn’t involve any frustrating moments.Price:The price sits in the mid-range category. Considering its ergonomic features, build quality, and comfort, it’s worth the investment. It’s definitely a great value for the price if you’re looking for a chair that combines style, comfort, and longevity.Highly recommended!

I like this chair! First, the installation was super easy—it took me about 40 minutes to set it up and no need addition tools. The manufacturer provided extra screws. Even if I accidentally drop and lose a screw during installation, I won’t have to worry since there are spares included.The armrests are very user-friendly, with adjustable height and angles to meet different needs. The backrest and headrest are also adjustable, providing excellent support. Whether it's for my lower back, upper back, or neck, I can really feel the ergonomic design taking care of me. Sitting on this chair is extremely comfortable, especially for long hours of work or relaxation. Overall, it’s a well-designed chair with an excellent user experience.

Review: This chair is quite paradoxical. It boasts quality in its materials, ease of assembly, and packaging. The seat and back use exceptionally comfortable materials. Review: I've been remiss in leaving reviews for all the many things I've purchased from Amazon but this one has frustrated/displeased me enough to break that trend. I'm 220 lbs and 6'0". I'm 66 yrs. old and have sat in hundreds of chairs like this one over the years. I've assembled them, used them for ages, and thrown them away after I've worn them out. If you're a short person you'll not have an issue with this chair. By short I mean no more than 5' probably. I set this chair to be at it's highest height as that's what is most comfortable for me. Unfortunately, as the day goes by it slowly sinks to the bottom height and I find my knees eventually crushing my chest. Now that's a slight exaggeration but you get the point.Yes, I know how to "lock" the mechanism. Every day, I use the handle to again lift the chair to its max height for the day's use, and then slowly but surely as time drags on it sinks to the bottom and becomes extremely uncomfortable and, essentially, unusable.I'd return it but the excessive difficulty putting it together, even with two people, makes the thought of disassembling it horrendous. And then to load it into a vehicle and actually wait in line somewhere to drop it off for return makes the process impossible.When it's at its best and standing tall this chair is extremely good, but give it an hour or so and it begins to become what, to me, is a very vociferous "DO NOT BUY" recommendation.One other minor irritation but a consistent one nonetheless are the arms. There is a rather large gap between the back of the arm and the back of the chair. If you wear shortsleeve shirts, and that's mandatory for me here in Florida, when you go to stand up your sleeve has a frequent tendency to get caught on the end of the arm causing some humorous gesticulations. A design flaw for me personally but probably won't be much of an issue for others.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2024

Review: I've tested 3 Ergonomic Office Chairs, 5 Gaming Chairs and to be honest, this one is the best for under $300. I tested out a Stples chair of the same quality at $470.00 with taxes and I'm glad I bought this one.No, I am not getting paid to say this. I love this chair and I see a few negative reviews here, so I'd love to share my thoughts.PROS:- the lumbar support and pillow are great. It's not too hard, not too soft.- pillows are adjustable. If you really don't like them, 1. Remove them and 2. Buy a memory foam velcro pillow that clips on, for a car. It's the same thing and twice as comfortable, for only $30-50 each. Smart savings.- the construction feels great and the material is virtually the same of other gaming chairs rated at $400-600 range. If you want a perfect gaming chair, be prepared to spend $700-900. It may be a lot, sure, but think of how long you're gonna own a chair, and think of the back pain it'll save you from. I had a small blue chair with no support from age 13-28, so it's time to upgrade.- If your chair breaks in some way, there is limited warranty from the supplier and amazon. But keep in mind, a chair for only $150.00, is a risk you take. That's super cheap for what you get.- the chair reclines almost at a full 180 degrees (approximately 170), allowing you to lay flat. I love it.- armests are adjustable, up and down only, not side to side or left to right.- I have sat in the chair for 6 hours, doing homework and gaming and I love it. I am 6' 0" at 185lbs. The chair is good for me but if you are over 215lbs, you may want a slightly wider chair.CONS:- armests are only 2D, not 4D. This is expected for the price.- no footrest, but that doesn't matter. I've tried the footrests for a lot of these chairs and they suck. 1. They're not long enough, so your feet hang, as the footrest ends, 6" before your heel, 2. They're not well made. 3. What I did instead was buy a $130.00 ottoman with storage, non-foldable, on Amazon, and it's a perfect footrest which I can move around freely. I use the storage for my gaming controllers and the ottoman fits perfectly under my desk if I want more space. In case I can't post a link in a review, here's the product info. Name: "Tufted Leather Square Flip Top Storage Ottoman Cube Foot Rest, Black" sold by "H&B Luxuries" on Amazon.- a review I saw "oh the plastic piece of the side broke." Not sure how, as this is fastened via 1 screw. If your screw hole is too big, add 1 small washer and this will fix the problem. Mine was fine. 1. Test out any product you get and 2. If there are any issues, it's your job to return them and get a new one or a refund. Accidents do happen in manufacturing, but instead, I see people complain, and write a bad review LOL. That's your fault brother.- it'd be nice if this chair came in more colours, but I love the black as it blends with everything. White & black usually do. I got an all black chair myself.
Comfy, stable, I'm probably a fraction too tall for it at 6'2"/6'3". Good deal for the price. I only swore a few times putting it together! Would buy again.
Took a some time to assemble, especially the sides angles. a great purchase, very comfortable. a great deal on the price.
I updated my chair to this and honestly it's a really good chair for back posture. Only thing the arms could be a bit longer...Other than that really happy with this purchase!
A bit squeaky in some areas, but overall pretty comfortable and a good price. (Currently on sale)

I recently decided to give the Amazon Basics Dry Floor Cleaning Cloths a try, and I must say, I'm thoroughly impressed with their performance. These cloths have become an essential part of my cleaning routine for various reasons.Firstly, the quality of the material is top-notch. They are thick and sturdy, ensuring they can handle the toughest cleaning tasks without tearing or falling apart. The size is perfect, providing ample coverage and making it easy to clean large areas efficiently.What sets these cloths apart is their exceptional dust and dirt-grabbing capabilities. Whether it's pet hair, crumbs, or fine dust particles, these cloths attract and lock them in, leaving my floors looking spotless. I've used them on hardwood, tile, and laminate, and the results have been consistently impressive.The cloths are also versatile in their application. I use them not only for regular floor cleaning but also for dusting surfaces like countertops and furniture. The anti-static properties prevent the cloths from leaving any residue, maintaining a clean and polished look.Another noteworthy feature is their compatibility with various floor cleaning tools. I've used them with both traditional brooms and sweepers, and they attach securely without slipping off during use. This makes them a convenient choice for anyone looking to upgrade their cleaning routine.Additionally, the affordability of Amazon Basics Dry Floor Cleaning Cloths is a significant advantage. You get a pack of multiple cloths at a reasonable price without compromising on quality. The fact that they are disposable makes cleanup a breeze, and I appreciate the convenience they offer.In conclusion, if you're in search of effective, durable, and budget-friendly dry floor cleaning cloths, look no further than Amazon Basics. These cloths have exceeded my expectations, and I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a reliable solution for keeping their floors and surfaces clean.

Review: The Basics Dry Floor Cloths have become an indispensable tool in my cleaning routine, offering a simple yet effective solution for tackling dust, dirt, and pet hair with ease.One of the standout features of these dry floor cloths is their versatility. Review: This unit is lightweight and the charge last an entire use no problem. I currently use an electric mop and over time I've noticed my grout isn't staying as white. Thought this product would be great to scrub grout, I was wrong. The unit doesnt have enough weight and only spins in one direction (making it want to glide on the floor) meaning you have more scrub power using it off and just manually scrubbing. In that event it's much cheaper just to go with a stiff grout brush that can attach to a broomstick handle. I took pictures of before (wet) and after using both a peroxide cleaner and dawn bleach mixture. You can see in the photo that the sudsy water sitting on the tile is not discolored and the grout color has no change (beyond anything few pieces of grit) even after using the stiff brush and manually scrubbing with it. Oh well, going back to hands and knees. This product would only be good with light duty and paired with an abrasive cleaner. Could work great for someone with mobility issues, but doesn't preform any better at scrubbing than a stick mop would. Can not recommend for anything more than a mop could do.

Review: The Electric Spin Scrubber has two speeds, but I found the low was pretty low. Even the high setting seemed mediocre, but when I actually used it it worked pretty well, I’ll tell you what. My bathtub bottom is pretty nasty, and I have been doing everything to avoid cleaning it. So when I got this Electric Spin Scrubber I figured I’d try cleaning the rest of the bathtub bottom. All I used was some hot water and Ajax, and it did a pretty good job at removing all the brown crud that had been accumulating for ages. It includes 3 nylon brushes — a flat brush an angled brush, and a semi-circular brush — that can handle most cleaning chores that I’ve encountered. There are also a variety of sponges. I’m not sure how to order replacement sponges however. Maybe some third party sells some but there didn’t seem to be any info in the included documentation about sponge replacement. I figure I will mostly use the nylon brushes, which should last quite awhile if I don’t abuse them. Oh, and that reminds me, I like that it has a color coded system telling you if you’re applying too much pressure with the brush. If you’re only applying light pressure I believe it lights up blue; when you apply normal pressure it lights up green, and if you are applying too much pressure it lights up red, telling you to back off a little.The brush head popped off once when I angled the scrubber at too much of an angle. No big deal, I just turned it off and pressed the brush back on. I sort of like the design of the brush attachment better than some other scrubbers that I’ve seen out there.Yes, you can scrub things by hand, but why bother when you can use something like this Electric Spin Scrubber to accomplish the same task, but with a lot less elbow grease?

I recently purchased the Bomves Electric Spin Scrubber, and it has completely cut down my cleaning time in HALF. From the moment I unboxed it, I could tell it was a high-quality product. The build is sturdy, and the extendable handle makes it comfortable to use for cleaning hard-to-reach places without bending or straining.The scrubber’s powerful 400 RPM motor works wonders, effortlessly removing tough stains from my bathroom tiles, shower, and even the car. Review: The O-Cedar EasyWring Microfiber Spin Mop and Bucket Floor Cleaning System has quickly become a staple in my cleaning routine. Here’s my honest take after using it for a few months.Ease of UseOne of the standout features is how easy this system is to use. The foot pedal on the bucket allows for hands-free wringing, which is a game changer. It’s incredibly satisfying to control the moisture level of the mop with just a few pumps. No more bending over or getting your hands dirty!Effective CleaningThe microfiber mop head is fantastic at picking up dirt, dust, and even pet hair. It’s highly effective on my hardwood floors and tiles, leaving them sparkling clean. The triangular shape of the mop head also makes it easy to reach into corners and tight spaces.Durability and BuildThe build quality is decent. The bucket is sturdy enough to withstand regular use, and the wringing mechanism works smoothly. However, the plastic parts, especially the handle, feel a bit flimsy. I haven’t had any breakages, but it’s something to keep an eye on with heavy use.ConvenienceThe system is lightweight and easy to maneuver around the house. The mop head is machine washable, which is a big plus for maintaining hygiene. The bucket's splash guard is a thoughtful addition, preventing water from splashing out while wringing.Size and StorageThe bucket is a good size, holding enough water for a thorough cleaning session without being too bulky. When it comes to storage, the system is fairly compact, but you’ll need a bit of space to tuck it away neatly.Room for ImprovementWhile I love this mop system, there are a couple of areas for improvement. Firstly, the handle could be more robust. It’s extendable, which is great for adjusting to different heights, but it sometimes feels like it might not hold up over time. Secondly, it would be nice if the mop head was a bit larger to cover more ground with each swipe.Final ThoughtsOverall, the O-Cedar EasyWring Microfiber Spin Mop and Bucket Floor Cleaning System is a solid choice for anyone looking to make mopping less of a chore. It’s effective, easy to use, and offers good value for the price. Just handle the parts with care to ensure longevity.Pros:Hands-free wringing with foot pedalEffective microfiber mop headEasy to maneuver and lightweightMachine washable mop headSplash guard on the bucketCons:Handle feels a bit flimsyMop head could be largerIf you’re looking for a convenient and efficient floor cleaning solution, the O-Cedar EasyWring is definitely worth considering. Happy mopping!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2024

Review: First off, let’s talk about how portable this mop is. It’s lightweight, which makes it easy to maneuver around the house. Whether you’re tackling hard-to-reach corners or going from room to room, it glides smoothly, and I found it very comfortable to use.One of the standout features for me is how easy it is to clean. The microfiber mop head does an excellent job of picking up dirt and grime, and when it comes time to clean it, the process is straightforward. The mop head is machine washable, which means I can keep it fresh without much hassle. This feature makes it ideal for anyone who wants a quick and effective cleaning solution.Now, onto a couple of downsides. The first thing I noticed is that the handle can feel a little flimsy. While it’s generally sturdy enough for regular use, I did find myself wishing for a bit more sturdiness when applying pressure for tougher spots. It’s not a deal-breaker, but it’s something to keep in mind, especially if you’re dealing with particularly stubborn stains.I’d suggest is the addition of a soap dispenser to the system. While the mop does a fantastic job of cleaning, having a built-in soap dispenser would make the process even more efficient. It would allow for a more thorough clean without needing to stop and grab a separate bottle of cleaning solution. A simple addition like this could streamline the whole experience.Overall, this is a solid choice for anyone looking for a practical and portable cleaning solution. Its ease of use and effective cleaning capabilities make it a valuable addition to any home. While the handle could be sturdier and a built-in soap dispenser would be a welcome improvement, these issues are relatively minor compared to the overall benefits of the product.I’d recommend this mop to anyone seeking an efficient way to keep their floors clean. It’s user-friendly and gets the job done, making it a great option for both everyday cleaning and those deeper cleans when needed.

After reading other reviews I was confident this would work and I was not disappointed.  The instructions are okay, but they don't tell you:  1)  If you have a spray attachment on the kitchen sink you can leave the whole shebang together as you fill it rather than having to awkwardly move the filled clean chamber into the outer (dirty water) bucket as the instructions direct.  2) Use the hottest water you can; it will cool as you work and likely still be warm as you finish.  3) When you first wet the mop head in the clean chamber, drag it against the sides of the clean chamber to drain it and preserve the clean supply, then spin it in the rinse chamber to achieve the desired wetness for mopping.Other reviewers pointed out that the mop handle could be longer.  i am reserving judgment on this as at 51" it worked fine for my 5'8" height.  There are also longer handles available;  just make sure to buy one with "European" threads which are finer than the big acme threads on your old brooms.As to reviewers who complained about the telescoping handle I suggest twisting with some muscle during setup.  If you still have a problem with collapsing then you can either epoxy the handle to keep it in place or use clear packing tape or duct tape to "freeze" the connections.I mopped about 900 square feet on a single bucket load (about 1 1/4 gallons) and the dirty water was equally dirty as when I was using a wide microfiber push-to-wring mop with a 2 gallon clean supply and a 2 gallon separate rinse bucket.This system does a good job of keeping the dirty water separate, the only exception being the minimal residual dirty water in the mop fibers after spin rinsing.For routine cleaning this is a fine system.  If you have a horrible mess, get out your scrub brush and bucket!The mop head triangular holder can be made to scrape the floor, but I found a quick hand spin will fling the mop ends out to a near circle, then back to work.  I suspect that with practice this issue will be very minor.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2024

Review: This mop system is the best. It is easy to use. I love that the clean and dirty water are kept separated. Mop heads remove easily for a good machine washing. If you want clean floors you need this mop system.

Review: My robot floor mop stopped working. I considered purchasing a replacement, but they are so expensive and my previous one never really mopped as well as a person. It's possible to spin the mop nearly dry or leave more water.There is a scrub brush attachment that can be purchased separately that is great for scrubbing floors and tubs/showers without bending.Cons:The mop head is a bit big to fit into the rinse well or spinner. A little more wiggle room would make it easier to use.The plastic head of the mop holder scrapes across the floor at times. I haven't noticed any scratches on the floor,  but the sound is grating.In summary, this was a good purchase. I enjoy using this mopping disturb more than the twisting mop types that I had to touch (yuck!) or swiffer type with reusable pads that don't wring out. The floors in my house are much cleaner than they've been in a long time. I am happy with the purchase and the result.

Review: I got this to make it easier to clean the large walk in shower.  The shower has tile but also has small “river stone” type floor and accent on the walls. This stone is not a smooth surface and holds water and then becomes gross. Scrubbing with a brush is tedious and hard on wrists and back, and a cloth just doesn’t really get it. This tool did the job well and I felt like it was clean. On the walls I can spray with cleaner and then use the short handle. It scrubs it more thoroughly and faster than I can manually. And for the floor I used the extended handle-so much easier! I am happy I got this and will likely clean the shower more often now. Not sure yet how or if I will use the other attachments, but over time will probably find something to do with them. My only concern is if the scrubber head wears out, and I’m sure it will over time, will I be able to replace it.

Review: Say goodbye to the hassle of traditional cleaning methods and hello to the future of household cleaning with the Keimi Electric Spin Scrubber. This innovative tool combines cutting-edge technology with user-friendly design to revolutionize your cleaning routine and give you back precious time for the things you love.Let's start with the basics – efficiency. With three adjustable speeds ranging from 260 to an impressive 420 rotations per minute (RPM), this electric scrubber cuts your cleaning time in half. Powered by an advanced lithium battery boasting a capacity of 2600 mAh, it can work continuously for up to 90 minutes on a single charge, ensuring that you can tackle even the toughest stains with ease.What sets the Keimi Electric Spin Scrubber apart is its versatility. Equipped with eight multi-functional brush heads, it's suitable for cleaning a wide range of surfaces and scenarios. From bathtubs and sinks to narrow corners and gaps, tile walls to car surfaces, this scrubber handles it all with precision and efficiency. Plus, with the retractable handle design, you can easily adjust the length from 35.8 to 43.3 inches, saving your back and knees from unnecessary strain.But the innovation doesn't stop there. The built-in digital display screen keeps you in control of your cleaning tasks, allowing you to monitor the battery life and select the spinning speed at any time. And with the added convenience of voice broadcast function, you'll always be informed of the scrubber's working status without any guesswork.What's more, Keimi is committed to quality and customer satisfaction. With 24-hour customer service and a dedication to resolving any issues promptly, you can trust that you're in good hands.In conclusion, the Keimi Electric Spin Scrubber is more than just a cleaning tool – it's a life and time-saving solution that transforms the way you clean. With its ease of use, long-lasting power, and versatility, it's a must-have addition to any home. Say hello to effortless cleaning and goodbye to the stress of household chores – Keimi has got you covered.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024

Review: This is your sign to buy this scrubber. I can actually scrub things again (and with very minimal effort!)I had debated forever on if I actually needed to buy something like this, and I really wish I'd have bought one sooner. I was always afraid to pull the trigger because I didn't want to be disappointed. After carefully combing through reviews, I bought this one on sale, and I'm so glad I did. I use it every week to detail my bathroom from top to bottom. There is an attachment for literally every surface. It really saves me so much time and energy, and I sweat a whole lot less because of it. This scrubber paired with the right cleaning supplies is magical, I'm not exaggerating.The only issue I have- is that the charge seems to run down fast even on the lowest speed. It's alarming to see it go from 100% to 90% in minutes, but I haven't had a problem with it dying or anything and it's just me being particular. I usually use it two weeks in a row before charging it. It charges pretty fast.I personally don't care for the voice, and it also doesn't make sense for the speaker to be in a place where it's very likely to get wet. I can see how it would be helpful for someone with low/no vision to use it though.I'm not crazy about it being wide angled and would prefer it be 90 degrees so I can get it flat/under some things, but it's not a deal breaker.I love that it comes with an adjustable extension pole. I have tile up to the ceiling in my shower, and this tool makes it so that I don't have to drag a step ladder into the shower area. It also saves my back for the lower areas. As a person with a lot of joint pain, chronic pain and issues, this tool is extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend it.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024

Review: This is a wonderful product. I just hold it to lightly touch the surface with a dilute amount of cleaning product. Speed 1 is sufficent for all the cleaning I have done. Review: I received this about 6 PM last night, the same day I ordered it.  I had pulled out my old one and it was not working even after changing batteries.  My children used to use these and I am betting that they put it back into the holder and accidentally left it turned on and the motor burned out.  I ran to the bathroom that had dirt and scum that I could not budge.  I first tried it without my homemade tea tree spray and it removed about half of the crud I could not remove even after soaking with vinegar.  I sprayed on my spray and it came off so easily.  Yeah, first test passed!  I then tried the clear shower curtain with the now damp head.  It did pretty good.  I then sprayed my tea tree spray and it removed all the white film on the curtain.  We now have an area where we can easily see the clock on the other side of the bathroom.  We have very hard water and the major coating is more lime than soap scum, but it worked great with the soap scum.  I then cleaned half of our sink area and it looks brand new!  Next I worked on my glass top induction cooktop.  Fantastic job!  It is as great as the original.  I also tried some of the old cleaning tips from three older brushes.  They all fit!  Now I will have tips forever!  There is a spot for a lanyard, but it was advertised to receive one and there wasn't one in the box.  Know problem, I can use the one from the older brush.Would I recommend this, yes.  Why?  Because it works well and Rubbermaid is still an American company even though everything was made in China.  The original brush was a company named Sonic Scrubber LLC and it was made in America.  Too bad we don't have manufacturing in the U.S. now.  I hope one day we will be making items here again.  Most things from China and that area of the world take forever to get here if they are not in stock here.  Okay, time to get off the soap box.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2024

Reviewer: Scrub Daddy vs Scrub Mommy - What's the Difference?
Review: These are sturdy sponges that do a very nice job of cleaning pots and pans. They don't scratch but they do a great job of removing all the food and crumbs - better than those pads that have a sponge on one side and a scouring pad on the other. The ridged portion of the edge is great for cleaning narrow places. The sponge itself is easy to hold and holds soap well, too. The only thing I don't care for is trying to clean utensils - you're supposed to put them in the happy face mouth to scrub them but this doesn't work all that well. I use a regular cleaning pad for that, but for other surfaces this Scrub Daddy is my go-to.  They last a long time, too. Well worth the money.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2024

Review: This things are amazing. They are the next best thing to the wired sponges. They don’t damage my pots and they get up nearly every hard stain / food residue. We use the scrub daddies for multiple things like removing stickers, cleaning things like counters, oven, grill, and floor, as well as the obvious our dishes. They are worth the money, they hold their shape for a long time, they take seconds to absorb water and depending on the water will depend on its texture. Warm water makes it soft and easy to manipulate and cold water make its tough and you can use the thickness to really put in the elbow grease.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024

Review: These are fantastic. Durable, great to ckean no stick pans scratch free. Comfortable to use in your hand. Stays smells free, unlike sponges. Very lasting making them a great value for the cost.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2024

Review: Scrub Daddy sponges are a standout for household cleaning, known for their unique texture that changes with water temperature—firm in cold water for tough stains and soft in warm for gentle cleaning. The clever design, featuring a smiley face, allows easy handling and efficient cleaning of utensils and containers. Despite being pricier than average sponges, their durability and effectiveness in not scratching surfaces justify the cost. Overall, Scrub Daddy offers a durable, versatile, and fun solution to everyday cleaning challenges.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2024

Review: Has to repurchase and found a good deal so I got them here but what else to say aside from the fact that they are great! Easy to use, work super great and make cleaning so much easier!!! Definitely a great value for the money!!

They are good at scrubbing pans and stove top, but not good at cleaning counters and have no absorbency.  I do like that they don't absorb odors.  I find that they are durable and work well on the bathtub and shower.

Review: These sponges hold soap, and the thick scratchy surface is super absorbent. It does a great job of removing stuck on stains. It’s easy; I just soap it up and go. It seems to be eco-friendly because it’s made of less plastic than my other sponges.

Review: Oh my goodness do these work well! They are better than any sponge  I have ever tried. With cold water they are rigid and tough, great for scrubbing tough things. They never smell, they do not scratch things up and they are so worth the money!!! I have one in the kitchen, the shower and even one I use to clean my pool. These are the best!!!

Review: I cleaned the walls of 8 rooms and 1 hallway over the span of 2 days with this thing. Review: This thing is pretty great at cleaning base boards & has the ability to clean quickly and easily. It saves my back and knees from all of the bending I used to have to do. I love the extra pads that came with it and I do love the way it mops in the corners & tight spaces easily. But the one thing that prevents me from giving 5 stars is because locked or unlocked it twists and turns while I’m cleaning and I constantly have to stop to get it back in place which is frustrating. I have to move with ease and care trying to find a groove with it, in hopes that it doesn’t start flipping around in order for it to work. It does flop less when locked but if I’m going around the baseboard cleaning and I’m having to stop constantly to reposition the darn thing it becomes a design flaw and a problem. Great concept, great design, but needs a few improvements to make it an excellent cleaning tool. I still use it and it’s still better than me bending over or getting down on the floor. I just wish there was a way to permanently lock it in place so it doesn’t move at all. I also wish there was a way to wring it without taking it off each time when I want to use a mop bucket that may be asking too much.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2024

Review: 1 star because 0 isn't an option. I bought this mop to clean the kitchen & bathroom walls and floors. If you never plan to use it we, go right ahead and buy it, but otherwise...BEWARE! I just used it for the kitchen floor and it's a sopping wet mess! The pad just holds too much water, unless you want to wring it out by hand after each dunk (gross). It also just sloshed the dirty water around on the floor. It doesn't easily rotate either to be able to use the squeegee side and won't stay in that configuration for long if you do get it to work. I was using it on a tile floor and it kept leaving puddles after crossing grout lines in multiple areas. While the floors look better than when I started, I know they're still dirty because it just spread the dirty water around everywhere! The squeegee REALLY showed the left behind dirt when I could get it to work... It's not great at scrubbing corners despite the shape; it seems to deposit dirt in them more than cleaning them. I even went back over it with a completely dry pad, but it's not picking up dirt particles left behind after sweeping. Also, you can't get a good umph behind it to scrub stubborn dirt spots either. I cleaned one area of the floor with my foot and a scrubbing sponge before I started (movable kitchen cart w/ microwave on top, so it just wasn't worth the hassle to relocate it to another room before mopping) and even THAT did a better job than this mop. There's NO WAY I'd even attempt to use this on the ceiling or walls, DO NOT BUY THIS!!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2024

Reviewer: IGADPole Window Cleaning Kit Presentation, Water Fed brush
Review: I bought IGAD water-fed telescopic pole and accessories for the price I would have paid to have the panels cleaned once by by a local solar panel cleaning company. The pole is heavy, but that makes it more sturdy and less wobbly while helping to clean dirt off the solar panels. The instructions were a little sparse, but it's not difficult to piece together. The brush head with the water/soap feeder works great! The other accessories are more than I needed, but makes for a multiuse extension pole for various cleaning needs. I've previously hosed the panels down with soft water with good results, but the IGAD system used with a soap for solar panels makes the panels look like new. If you've got the muscles, this is perfect for keeping solar panels clean and efficient.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024

Review: The telescoping pole gets a bit flimsy when fully extended so I had to use a ladder and not use the last two sections. Also the water hose going to the brush at the shut off valve had a problem and blew up. I had to cut it off and reattach, which was a bit of a pain because they used a non standard clip.Having said that, I was able to clean the solar panels. The first picture shows half the panels cleaned so you can see the difference it makes and the second picture shows the entire set of panels done.The water conditioner liquid they give works alright and prevents the need to squeegee the panels.After I was done, the panels generated around 10%-12% more power, so after one use this thing paid for itself.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2024

Review: As someone who has struggled with cleaning solar panels and second-story windows in the past, this GADPole kit has been an absolute game-changer. Right out of the box, I was impressed by how well-made and sturdy the pole sections feel - this is clearly a premium product built to last. Assembling the full 24 foot pole is straightforward, and the thick rubber grip makes it easy to control and maneuver even when fully extended. The included soap dispenser attaches securely and puts out just the right amount of cleaning solution. In use, the microfiber brush head does an amazing job cutting through grime and water stains. Cleaning used to leave my windows streaky, but this brush lays down a perfectly even coat of solution. The squeegee then glides smoothly across to leave a crystal clear, spotless finish. Storing the pole sections in the included carrying bag keeps everything organized. Little touches like the pole threads being compatible with standard hose attachments show the thoughtful design. Overall, this kit has made washing even my tallest windows a breeze. The quality construction inspires confidence when working at heights. While an investment, it has already paid for itself many times over in time and frustration saved. I can't recommend this window cleaning kit highly enough!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024

Review: Window Cleaning Kit (24 Feet) - Disappointing First UseI was eager to purchase this window cleaning kit, as I have very high windows that often get dirty. Normally, I have to hire a cleaning company, which is both inconvenient and expensive. I was thrilled to find this product, as it seemed like the perfect solution for cleaning my windows independently.Unfortunately, my excitement was short-lived. Upon extending the pole and beginning to wash my windows, the pole broke during the first use. While I understand that wear and tear can happen over time, this was unexpected and extremely disappointing for a brand-new product. I had high hopes that this kit would make my life easier, but it failed to meet my expectations.While other users may have a different experience, mine was subpar. I cannot recommend this product based on my experience and will be looking for an alternative. It’s disheartening to invest in a product that doesn’t deliver on its promise, especially when it breaks so easily.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2024

Review: I was impressed with the build quality of the pole assembly and the water brush!  I cleaned my solar panels yesterday, and all of the dirt that had accumulated over the summer into a caked-on mess EASILY came off with this cleaning tool!  Only effort required was just pushing the brush back and forth on the panels, as just the weight of the pole and brush assembly applied the necessary scrubbing pressure to get all the gunk off!  I was standing on a ladder when using this product, and the adjustable pole length was perfect for reaching the two rows of panels on my roof. (I did NOT use the soap dispenser, so cannot comment on its function).  My solar panel electricity production increased about 15% after cleaning, so I will definitely be cleaning them more often now with this great cleaning tool so I can get more $$ ouf of my solar panel investment!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2024

Review: We used it for cleaning solar panels on the roof of two homes. After use we found it was better engineered than we had expected. The telescoping handle made it easy to adjust length while up on a ladder. The brush attachment was the right size to not be too heavy at the end of a 30 ft pole. The brush was all we needed for solar. The in line soap dispenser worked well and is necessary. Two water jets into the brush were more than adequate. The water volume through the hose was very sufficient. The in line shut off valve was very useful. The valve changing from soap to rinse worked well. The pole was not too heavy at full extension nor too pliable. If working from a ladder it is useful to have an assistant for ground support. Very good value for the money.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024

Review: Ordered this to do my house windows, arrived in solid packaging, easy to set up, used WD40 to ease the opening and closing of the pole. It worked easily on my water pressure didn't need to attach it via my pressure washer. The pole was easy to use, lightweight, easily reached my first floor windows, easy to adjust the angle of the brush, easy to use the detergent container. Having washed and rinsed the windows found the window blade not easy to remove the excess water, so I attached the micro fibre squeegee and managed to dry the windows that way.Very pleased with this item, well worth the money in my opinion.
Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 10, 2024

Review: This kit is great, a bit heavy at full extension doing facia boards, sofits and gutters where you are taking the full weight. But did a great job cleaning them. No problem cleaning windows as the weight is not on the operator. The parts seem of good quality. The soap dispenser and tap work great.Very pleased so far.
Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 1, 2024

Review: I only leave reviews when it either works or not.I was a bit sceptical at first based on other products which I have bought.  Product arrived well before due date.  Took a moment to work out how to assemble but was easy to do in the end.At full extension it wobbles a bit (bought the 7M) but I was able to reach the guttering easy.- Water flow was great- Cleaning fluid attachment worked great (would recommend putting in small amounts at a time as the constant flow of water will use up the cleaner quickly).  I did not realise you could turn the cleaning fluid on and off....... so for future users, remember that.  And because I had to try it right away, I used washing up liquid, it was brilliant, no water marks etc.- Stop valve worked a treat.  I did not attach to start with and had to keep walking to the tap to turn on and off.  would recommend attaching when assembling.- Between 80 and 100% extension the pole would sometimes collapse slightly within itself (shorten), I am not sure if it was me not 'locking' it well or just a fault.  Will be using it on my neighbour's windows soon so will see if it happens again.Based on the prices I was quoted to clean my windows and large conservatory, this was an absolute bargain.  I was surprised by how well the brush worked on the dirt.  Felt really sturdy, wasn't heavy to manoeuvre.  Flow of water was constant.  I did not get soaked in water from the pole.  The brush head tilts so you can easily clean the window ledges.  Cleaning everything was easy and quick, no aches in the arms after.Highly recommend.
Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 8, 2024

Review: Out the box, it was easy to connect all the parts to what you need. I used it to clean my solar panels which workd really well. The different attachments with quick changeover makes it very versatile. This made cleaning the panels easy and with the long reach of the handle I managed to get all cleaned. This is quite sturdy and should last a while.Great design
Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 30, 2024

Review: Great product thats simple to use and really effective.Did a great job cleaning the conservatory roof. Removed moss and bird poop with ease. Did take a while but that's probably me taking it easy.Highly adjustable but does kill your arms after a while. That's just the nature of this type of product and not a negative point towards this product. The pole is aluminum and lightweight.Yes it does flex when at full extension but again this can't be avoided without making the product heavier.Simple to assemble and didn't leak. I didn't bother fitting the tap, just used a stop hozelock connection instead.It's expensive for what it is but should last a while if looked after.
Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 30, 2024

Review: I have been using this with my tiled shower because there’s a lot of grout, and it has worked wonders. Review: I hate to clean, esp mop. This is the easiest most sturdy mop I've ever owned. Even better than my Shark steam mop. Which is a 5 🌟 mop in itself. This one is super easy to use. It comes with 4 pads, 2 each, for either floors or walls, I assume. I've cleaned my walls with the smooth one and my laminate with the ribbed one. The way it cleans itself is amazing. Im amazed how light it is when full of water. The long pole is great. I don't have to lean down and break my back. Plus it reaches my slanted 15ft ceilings. Definitely worth the money. I'd recommend it to anyone.  As a sahm/w. It makes it so much easier to clean up. The pads are made of great quality fibers.  The only thing that could use some tweaking. Is the little slips that hold the pads on. When they get wet the one side slips off and gets stuck in the mop slips on the bucket. Only compliant i have. I have to keep putting the pad back on the velcro part and re adjusting it. Maybe I'm too rough. it's a little bit annoying to get into a groove of mopping and you have to stop cuz it's gotten stuck. But 100% worth buying either way. Great mop! Thank you. Totally buy it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2024

Review: I bought this to aid in the deep cleanup after a fire. I needed to clean the ceilings and walls, and this beat the heck out of climbing up and down a ladder every two swipes to rinse a rag. I had a real cheap Dollar Tree version of the flat mop I was using, and it was good, except the mop head was small and not very thick, so it was good for one swipe, then had to be rinsed out to remove the soot. So, I saw this and thought it was a FANTASTIC alternative and ordered one right away.All seemed well, until I went to use it.  On a dry run, I tested the two slots, to be sure I would be able to stay on the ladder to rinse and squeegee dry. What a time saver!I dipped into the clean water tank, and it took a few tries to get it in the slot in the right. When it did go in, it was easy. I pulled it back out and commenced with the ceiling.  BEAUTIFUL!  It worked very nicely for me. Then I went to rinse it, jabbing it up and down a few times, inserted in the squeegee dry slot and pulled back out.I would have been utterly ecstatic, if not for the simple fact that the tank is not deep enough to rinse the entire mop, nor is the dry side deep enough to squeegee the entire mop.  It is about an inch too shallow. The mop comes out mostly clean and read to go again, except for that inch or so at the top side.  All the sludge and soot IO just cleaned is still there, unable to squeeze it out or rinse with clean water in the tank. That might be easily remedied if one could just turn the head the opposite way and dip again. That is not possible, as the head has a strong magnet that is made to lock the swiveling head in place for the rinse and dry. It only locks one way, and if you try to fit it in the slots the other way, it won't fit. I also found myself fighting the magnetic lock when using it overhead, as it tended to snap into the lock position when I didn't want it to.I don't know how such a major flaw got past R&D, when logic would tell them the tank HAS to be deeper than the length of the mop! The amazing squeegee takes out almost ALL the dirty water, allowing you to dip into the clean tank and emerge with a very clean reloaded mop. But only once. Since it is already not quite deep enough to submerge the whole mop, it also becomes less and less accommodating as you use the soapy water with each new reload.I would have loved to give this 5 stars, but right now, I wasted my money. It would be great for light cleaning, but nothing about my needs entails light duty anything.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023

The YFUIF 2-Pack Damp Clean Duster Sponge is a versatile cleaning tool designed to make household cleaning tasks faster and more efficient. From baseboards to blinds, this sponge aims to simplify cleaning tasks that usually require extra effort. Here’s a breakdown of its pros and cons:ProsEffective on Multiple Surfaces: This sponge is designed to clean a variety of surfaces, including baseboards, blinds, vents, glass, mirrors, and even hard-to-reach window track grooves. It’s a good all-in-one tool for tackling dusty or grimy surfaces around the home.Magic Eraser-Like Cleaning Power: Similar to magic erasers, this sponge works well with just water, making it effective at lifting dust, dirt, and scuffs without harsh chemicals. It’s especially handy for scrubbing out stubborn grime and dirt from intricate surfaces like vents and railings.Flexible and Easy to Hold: The sponge is flexible, so it can contour to rounded surfaces, which is helpful for baseboards, railings, and blinds. Its ergonomic design makes it easy to hold and maneuver, reducing strain on the hands during cleaning.Reusable and Durable: Each sponge in the 2-pack is made from durable material, so it can be rinsed and reused multiple times before needing a replacement. This durability makes it a cost-effective option for regular cleaning.Compact and Easy to Store: The sponges are compact and lightweight, so they’re easy to store in small cleaning caddies or drawers. Their size also makes them suitable for getting into small spaces and crevices that larger tools might miss.ConsLimited Size: The sponges are on the smaller side, which is great for detailed cleaning but may require more time if used on larger surfaces. For example, cleaning an entire wall or extensive area might take longer compared to using a larger cleaning tool.Wears Out with Heavy Use: Although reusable, the sponges can start to wear out or break down with frequent, heavy scrubbing. They work best on light to medium cleaning tasks but may not last as long if used on rougher or highly textured surfaces.Doesn’t Hold Up to Harsh Chemicals: Since the sponge is designed for use with water or mild cleaning agents, it may not be compatible with strong chemicals. Harsh cleaning solutions can cause it to wear out faster, so it’s best suited for lighter, everyday cleaning.ConclusionThe YFUIF 2-Pack Damp Clean Duster Sponge is a convenient and affordable addition to any cleaning routine. Its versatility and ability to clean multiple surfaces with just water make it an eco-friendly and user-friendly option, particularly for tackling hard-to-reach areas. While it may wear out faster with heavy-duty use, it’s effective for regular dusting and light cleaning around the home. For those looking for a compact, multipurpose sponge to simplify dusting and spot-cleaning tasks, this 2-pack is a great choice.

Its design is straightforward yet effective, featuring a comfortable grip and a sturdy blade that can easily remove paint, adhesive, and grime from various surfaces.**Pros:**1. **Versatility:** The scraper works well on glass, metal, and plastic surfaces, making it a go-to for home improvement projects and everyday cleaning.2. **Ease of Use:** The ergonomic handle ensures a comfortable grip, reducing fatigue during extended use.3. **Replacement Blades:** Many models allow for easy blade replacement, extending the tool's lifespan and maintaining sharpness for optimal performance.4. **Compact Size:** Its small size makes it easy to store in a toolbox or kitchen drawer, ensuring it’s always within reach when needed.**Cons:**1. **Blade Durability:** While effective, the blades can dull quickly with heavy use, requiring frequent replacements.2. **Safety Concerns:** The sharp blade can pose a risk if not handled properly, necessitating caution during use.**Overall Impression:**The razor scraper is a practical and affordable tool that delivers excellent results for various cleaning tasks. Review: I love my new 4-piece linen bedding set! This set includes a fully elasticized fitted sheet (16" deep pocket, 76" x 57"), a flat sheet (102" x 90"), and two standard pillowcases (28" x 20"), all made from 100% Certified European Flax Linen and manufactured in Pakistan. I was initially concerned because I thought I had ordered a Full size, but the Queen size fits perfectly, especially with my mattress topper.What really stands out to me is the quality. The linen feels durable and has a beautiful, natural texture. It’s not as smooth as cotton, but it has its own charm, and it keeps me warm in the winter without being too heavy. I also love that it's free from harmful chemicals or dyes, which makes it even more comfortable to sleep in.The slate grey color is gorgeous and matches my bedding perfectly, adding a touch of elegance to my bedroom. I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it is to care for—just a quick wash and a steam iron, and it looks great again. I can tell this set is built to last, and I expect it to hold up well over time.Overall, I am extremely happy with this purchase. It’s a durable, eco-friendly bedding set that’s both practical and beautiful. Plus, knowing it's made in Pakistan adds a layer of appreciation for its craftsmanship. Highly recommend it!

Review: These sheets are interesting. Yes, they feel sturdy, rich, and of high quality fabric. I prewashed them like it told me to, which did shrink them up a bit (as it should). I hung them to dry and they dried nicely. The fitted sheets are snug but I like that they don't gap and sag. The flat sheet is a great fit. The pillow cases nicely fit a standard pillow. The sheets look amazing on the bed, with a rich green color and great textural appeal. They are warm without being too stuffy. But, they are rough. I rewashed them, thinking they just needed to soften up a bit. But they are still very rough. They aren't impossible to sleep on, but they aren't soft. I suppose it's a matter of knowing what you look for in a sheet set.

Review: Unfortunately, I don't recommend these linen sheets given their roughness and pilling, and I say that having had many linen products and knowing what to expect from new linen.  I think shoppers would be better off spending $10-$20 more, which isn't much at this price range, for a set from brands like Land's End, Pottery Barn, or Quince.  Or spending 2x/3x on brands like Parachute or Brooklinen.  Or possibly forgoing linen sheets for a nice cotton percale set or viscose set.I've had other flax linen items, including clothing as well as bedding.  The duvet covers have ranged from higher-end brands like Parachute to lower-priced brands from Amazon and elsewhere. This linen was very rough and sandpapery out of the packaging.  And even after a thorough washing and drying (and the expected large amount of lint from washing linen items for the first time) this sheet set is still rough.  It also ended up with dozens of little pills all over after the first wash (not to be mistaken with the slubs, which are the little lumps that are natural to linen fabric).Most linen, even high-quality stuff, may start a little "rough," but between how rough these sheets are even after washing AND the pilling, I think these may be lower-quaity linen instead of high-quality flax linen that the price would indicate.The weave is also interesting but doesn't have a nice feel. It looks and feels more like a paper towel than other linen items I have, which have a more visible close weave or plain weave.  It doesn't feel pleasant to my skin.I was looking for a set as an alternative to the viscose sheets I've been using in warm weather—something comfortable and a bit warmer but still breathable. I hoped these sheets, especially with a list price of $119.99 for a king set (at the time of writing), would be that set, but they are too rough for my taste.The sizing and color are accurate, and the stitching is done well.  Unfortunately, those "pros" (which meet my baseline expectations at this price) don't make up for the roughness and pilling.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2024

Review: These linen sheets are an absolute dream! The 100% pure European flax linen feels luxurious and breathable, making them perfect for hot sleepers like me. The set includes everything you need: a fitted sheet, flat sheet, and two pillowcases, all expertly crafted and durable. Reviewer: Threadmill Home Linen 800 TC Cotton Sheet Sets
Review: I'm fussy when it comes to sheets. I live in Florida and I think you should have different sheets for summer and winter. With that said, I truly feel you can use these sheets year round.I washed them before I used them the first time and I thought they felt OK. After the third washing I thought they were amazing and they just keep getting better.These Threadmill sheets are 100% cotton and have an 800 thread count. I got them on sale but I do not feel $100 for king size sheets is out of line. If you look at the amount of fabric involved in making king size sheets , they are well worth the cost. Sure you could get cheaper sheets, but they would feel cheaper and they probably would have polyester or microfiber (UGH) blended in.I wash the top sheet, the fitted sheet and both pillow cases together. I have a pretty good size washer. However, when it comes to drying them, I dry the fitted sheet separately. Pillow cases get terribly winkled when they get caught up in the corners of the fitted sheet. So, the fitted sheet gets dried by itself. It then gets folded or put back on the bed. Then the top sheet and the pillow cases get dried. I always use dryer balls. The sheets come out great. Are they a little wrinkled? Sure but so what! The sheets are cotton and they are soft. Smooth them out a bit on the bed and they're perfect.Did I say these sheets are soft? They are but they are not thin. They have a substantial and luxurious feel. They don't feel like soft flannel. Good thing because I live in Florida. They don't feel like the fabric has been brushed or sueded.These are beautiful sheets that just keep getting better! Can't wait to buy my next set!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2023

Review: It’s difficult to find good quality, 100% cotton sheets anymore. They have a soft sateen finish and crisp, breathable weave so we keep cool. As all truly 100% cotton sheets, they will wrinkle. I take them out of dryer slightly damp, hang on a hanger and smooth with my hands before leaving them to dry. A few shallow wrinkles are good enough for us. I’m glad we lucked out with these. Thinking of buying another set.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2024

Review: I love these! I found them after staying at an airBnB, they had the king sized 1000 cotton ones. Those were very thick, I had never slept on sheets that thick before. Neither had my friend, she agreed they were lovely but she could not get over the thickness. I purchased the Threadmill 800 sateen ones in ivory for a queen. Here is what I found:  -compared to Pure Beech sheets (Bed, Bath & Beyond) these are way, way thicker. With Pure Beech I feel a large part of the softness is due to how thin the sheets are. A set lasts me less than a year before they start to wear in spots and get holes. Pure Beech sheets are also see through in the lighter colors, that is not the case with Threadmill-- I bought the ivory ones and cannot see through them, I also do not worry about washing Threadmill and them falling apart. Threadmill sateen sheets give me more of a thick/satin/cotton feel , with Pure Beech I get a thin/satin/silk feel.  -compared to Mellanni (Amazon-boasted as their highest rated, affordable sheet set) Threadmill sheets are also thicker than Mellanni. Mellanni is what the reviews claim though. They are a good, soft, durable sheet set, especially for the price and they come in so many colors. I switched to Mellanni when I got irritated with how often I was replacing my Pure Beech sheets and as a cheaper way to switch up my sheet colors without a hefty price. Threadmill still wins out for me, they are like the luxury version of Mellanni.  -Threadmill does wrinkle, if you like crisp sheets-- take them out of the dryer right away. The wrinkles do relax pretty quickly though.  -after washing and drying on low heat, the fitted sheet fits on my regular queen bed with plenty of excess under my bed. I could probably add a 2-3 inch topper and still be good.  -I expect the sheets will loosen with washes. Compare the thickness of these sheets to the thickness of a folded paper towel  -I read that people have issues finding which end the fitted sheet goes on the bed, a simple trick I found that applies to most sheet sheets is the tag in the inside of the fitted sheet goes on the bottom right hand corner of the bed. The tag on the bottom of the flat sheet goes in that same corner.Hope this helps :)
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2022

Review: Finally found the best sheets!! Nicely made, crisp and thick pockets are thick and all stays in place even with the way I move all night my sheets aren’t all crinkled and lumpy. They are so comfortable and will last more than 1 season. I will never buy any other sheets from anywhere else. I will always buy this brand.

This is a very nice comforter! I had it in my cart for a few days then a few colors went on sale so I made the plunge.I love the color (Sage) and the weight of it is perfect for fall nights. It is heavier than I expected - even though it’s not thick, it weighs a lot!The queen size fits my bed well but I don’t have a super thick mattress, so keep that in mind.I washed it as soon as it arrived (cool wash, dry on low setting) and it came out ok but had some wrinkles and waves, as seen in my photos. When I pulled/stretched the underside of the comforter most, but not all of the waves flattened out. There is one spot that looks weird- like the furry part was cut too short or something. It’s not enough of an issue to return it and is not noticeable unless you’re looking for flaws.The pillow cases are also nice but they are too hot for me to sleep on so are decorative.I have not noticed any static issues and it did not shed in my dryer. Not at all!! I was shocked that there was literally a tiny amount of fuzz in my filter. It did take almost 2 hours to dry on low but I read on other reviews that using too much heat can melt the fuzz. Mine came out fine but I was patient and moved it around every 30 min to make sure l sides were drying evenly. I added a few wool balls to help with the drying. I have a an older, normal size front loading washer and dryer and it fit in both, with no room to spare.It looks like a quality item and so far I am very pleased with my purchase. The inside is soft enough that you could skip a top sheet if so inclined. It is super comfy and warm but not too hot and I am glad I went ahead and bought it! Great value for the money!

Review: I ordered the oversized CA King for a queen bed because I hate dust ruffles and want more coverage.  It was a mistake.  This picture is a little deceptive because I have it shorter on the side that doesn't show. So it's too long and not wide enough.  Should have measured.  I may try another size because I love this comforter so much.  Not really crazy about how it looks, but I've always been more into comfort than style. Also making the bed is a bit of a pain because it doesn't just lay right all by itself.  It kind of bags up at the edges and you have to mess with it to straighten it.  Probably why something with such a high approval rating is frequently returned. That said, It is absolutely the most comfortable thing I've ever had on my bed.  Light but warm and breathes well.  It's also the first comforter I've ever had that my feet are happy with.  I end up sleeping with my feet outside the blankets because weight bothers them.  Not with this one.  It is also cat approved.  For some reason, even though my cats love it, I never see cat hair on it.  Yay!! Also washes well, though I've only washed it once - when I first got it.  Came out of the dryer perfect.  In spite of the complaints I mentioned (and believe me I really hate inconvenience), it gets 5 stars because I can't overstate how soft and comfortable it is.

Review: These sheets have been an experience! Fortunately, in the end, a good one. If you want the quick version, scroll to the end. For details, read on!When I opened the package my heart dropped. These are thin enough to see through, have a weird almost rough feeling (at least if you're used to satin weave/Egyptian cotton like I am). I put them through the wash anyways and gave them a go. They washed very well per the given instructions and were much softer after washing, but still not a texture I am used to. I made my queen bed with them and found one corner has a saggy/baggy fit. I have a very thick mattress so usually sheets for deep mattresses are just fine...and it was only the one corner, so there is definitely some sort of fit issue. They have a crinkly linen look as advertised, which I don't mind at all and rather like. The color is nice/as advertised. I slept on them and was pleasantly surprised- and prompted to research washed cotton. The only issue is the odd fit in that one corner (better too big than too small at least). Also, after the second washing, they fit a bit better.These sheets are everything washed cotton is supposed to be! Washed cotton is supposed to be an open/airy weave (coarser) and very breathable. This is a feel you will either love or hate. I'm used to very smooth, well-worn Egyptian cotton and was very unsure at first. However, the texture really grew on me. Though a different feel, they are soft and pleasant, just in a different way. They hold a little more heat around my body and have less of the cold touch than Egyptian cotton, but they also breathe great (sounds like a weird combo, but they do). If you are a sweaty sleeper like me, these are a dream because they dry way faster than tigther weave Egyptian cotton/higher thread count sheets do.I docked the star for the odd fit and because I could not find a thread count specified anywhere. For this price, I feel that fit should be better and a thread count provided, even though it matters less for washed cotton than regular or Egyptian (from what I can find). However, the fabric is lovely to me. I want more washed cotton sheets now! I would not normally rate a poorly fitting sheet at 4 stars, so let that be an indication of how much I like the fabric and performance of the material. I hope the seller is able to incorporate size feedback and fix that issue, because these are otherwise fantastic and I would still recommend them based on comfort.Quick Version-True washed cotton feel and performance...which you will love or hate. Washed cotton is a looser/coarser weave but still soft. Read above or do some research first if you haven't used it before.-Breathe great, good for sweaty/warm sleepers.-Pretty color & attractive crinkly linen look.-Reasonably priced for 100% washed cotton, though I'd like to see a thread count easier to find and the fit issue corrected (see below).-Ample size for thick mattresses.-Fit issue: one corner was baggy and "off" (see photo)...it improved a bit with the second washing and attention to tucking extra fabric deeply under the mattress.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023

Review: This is very pretty set of sheets! Easy to put on the bed and they stay in place. Very nice cotton sheets! They feel very soft. Not scratchy at all. No problems with washing. I'm happy with this set of sheets and I would recommend them!

Review: These are 100% cotton. The hand feels rough (which tends to happen with 100% Cotton). I only use cotton bed sheets because it is durable and breathable. The sheets fit true to size and the thread count is decent.100% cotton feels more on the "rough" side. I think most of us are used to synthetics or cotton/polyester blends. This also means the bed sheets easily wrinkle and need to be dried on a cool setting or outside because heat will make them shrink.I'm not sure if this happened to anyone else. I received my bed sheets without any packaging from the supplier/brand. It was packaged neatly tied in a bow and placed inside of an Amazon box. The bow was made out muslin. I wish the sheets came in a plastic casing incase it were to get damaged during delivery. I also like the plastic packaging bed sheets that usually come in as proper storage. I love the sheets but docked a star for this.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023

Review: The 100% Washed Cotton Sheet Set in Solid Sage Green has elevated my bedding experience to a new level of comfort and style. From the moment I slipped between the sheets, it was evident that these linens were crafted with meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to delivering a luxurious feel.The washed cotton material embodies a perfect blend of comfort and durability. The sheets have a soft, breathable texture that provides a cozy and inviting touch, ensuring a restful night's sleep regardless of the season. The linen feel adds a layer of sophistication, creating a bed that looks as good as it feels.The simple yet stylish design in Solid Sage Green brings a calming and refreshing aesthetic to my bedroom. The color is exactly as pictured, adding a subtle touch of elegance that complements various decor styles. The sheets have a timeless appeal that effortlessly enhances the overall ambiance of the room.What sets these sheets apart is their versatility across all seasons. They provide a breathable and airy feel in warmer months while offering a cozy warmth during colder nights. The durability of the material ensures that these sheets maintain their high-quality look and feel, wash after wash.The Queen size fit is impeccable, with deep pockets that easily accommodate thicker mattresses. The fitted sheet stays securely in place, eliminating the frustration of slipping corners. Making the bed has become a simple and enjoyable task with these sheets.In conclusion, the 100% Washed Cotton Sheet Set in Solid Sage Green delivers a superior bedding experience that exceeds expectations. The combination of comfort, style, and durability makes these sheets a standout choice for those seeking a touch of luxury in their sleep sanctuary.

Review: Extraordinarily soft plush and warm luxury blanket.  I've purchased this wonderful blanket a number of times.  It's fluffy warm, comfortable & cozy, reversible, and very soft.  This 300 GSM (grams per square meter) blanket gives a great nights sleep and is available in a variety of over 30 vibrant colors, and sizes to suit your needs.  Exceptionally soft and priced right, these blankets give you the quality and value you deserve.  I have not seen any shedding in the many years I've used these.  For exceptionally cold weather, my go-to blankets are the UTOPIA 480 GSM thick exceptionally plush yet mediumweight blanket that has the warmth of a heavy weight blanket.  It's also made of high-quality materials that match the color of the advertised product.  These two types of blankets make great gifts.  When the frigid wind is blowing, this is what I like to wrap up in for a quick warmup on a sofa or recliner.  Fleece blankets are great to keep in a vehicle on trips, boxed-up in the trunk for emergencies, as an extra blanket when away from home for the night, or for outdoor activities like camping and watching the night sky.  Kids just love both brands of these blankets, which might be used as a make-shift sleeping bag.  It's humorous to see the dogs cuddle up on these blankets.  Take the bitter edge off of winter cold with this luxurious blanket.

These sheets truly elevate my sleep experience, and I know I'll be buying them again when needed.From the moment I first laid down on these sheets, I felt the difference. Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2024

Review: Well I didn't expect to find such nice sheets after my favorite 100% cotton ones ripped last week, but here they are! (The ones I've bought for years are no longer available, which was a big bummer.) I really wanted 100% cotton sheets, and yet the all cotton ones can be scratchy, especially if you're not willing to pay $100's for a set (I've already returned a few other brands). Well these sheets are FANTASTIC, they feel luxurious, and they won't break your bank! They washed up nice and soft, and they cover smoothly with a good fit, but not so tight that you have to lift weights to pull them over the edges. In fact, their corners had a unique feature I've not seen before that allows them to be reinforced very nicely and tuck all the way under with plenty of material. They're also thick enough, with a rich, soft feel to them. I honestly think these are my new favorite sheets. PLUS: the top sheet is just slightly bigger by an inch or two, so no more barely covered mattresses. I really love these sheets and can't wait to crawl into them tonight!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2024

Review: A lot of sheets advertise they're like hotel sheets (and aren't): but these really are: that kinda heavy thick crisp smooth cotton that feels great and is very sturdy and doesn't cling to you or tangle (so, nice and cool!) Here's the thing about hotel sheets: they are that thick and sturdy because they have to stand up to lots of commercial laundering, and those laundries have pressing machines to make them flat and smooth. Retail sheet makers aren't interested in making sheets that thick no matter what they state on the label. We've tried a lot of "premium" high-thread-count sheets and had them be disappointingly thin and not enduring... my husband tore our prior expensive Pottery Barn sheet with just an ordinary ragged toenail.  I got these Lane Linens on a Prime Day sale and we freakin' love them. 6 months in, they are still nice and thick and luxurious-feeling. Despite their thickness, they don't get many wrinkles, and I can't imagine being able to tear one with a toenail.  These are a heck of a value for the money. If these ever wear out, I'm for sure buying more.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2024

Review: Love these sheets.  They have some "weight" to them and are soft.  Nice deep pockets on the fitted sheet.  The only reason for not giving this 5 stars is that they don't launder great.  They come out quite wrinkled, but if you work with them a bit (I use Febreeze spray and then kind of wipe them down) it helps.  Would buy again
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024

Review: Edited 10/28/24. I loved these so much I ordered another set in ivory.  Just as soft and thick.  However, the fitted sheet is a tad smaller and it doesn't have the "front or back" label.  Back to remembering which corner gets the fabric tag.  Still love the sheets and now I have a back up that I got on sale!First off, I am a sheet snob.  I love soft, well made all-cotton sheets.  These are beautifully constructed.  They fit my 14" thick mattress.  I have washed them twice now and I think they have shrunk just a bit.  The fitted sheet is still perfectly fitted.  I love that there is a 'Top or Bottom' tag in the middle of the fitted sheet as I'm always looking for the tag and trying to remember which corner it goes on!  These are soft and thick cotton luxury.  So far, the top of the flat sheet hasn't crunched up from washing and drying like others, causing me to get out the iron, which I hate!  The width and length are also perfect.The only thing I'd like different is to stop with the 'tuck in' flap on the pillowcases and just put stitching on both sides.  I'd like to turn the pillow over and have the stitching show.  Otherwise, bliss!!!
